title: Bungling Ayia Napa rape probe cop didn’t even bother to take notes because he was TOO BUSY, Brit’s mum reveals – The Sun
text:
THE MUM of a British teen at the centre of a gang rape case in Ayia Napa has said a police officer failed to take notes because he was 'too busy' on the night of the supposed attack.

The 19-year-old, now facing a year behind bars after being found guilty of making up claims she was raped by 12 young Israelis, says Cypriot police coerced her into a confession after a bungled investigation.

10 The teenager will stand before a Cypriot judge tomorrow to face sentencing Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 The young woman's mum spoke via video link from Ayia Napa

10 Her mother spoke to hosts Holly and Phil on the This Morning programme about her fears for her daughter's wellbeing Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

The teen's mum appeared on today's This Morning programme to talk about her daughter's case before she is due to be sentenced before a Cypriot judge tomorrow.

Her mother claims that a police officer told the court in a previous hearing that he never took any notes down on the night of the incident because he was 'too busy'.

She went onto slam Cypriot law as 'wrong' and a 'disgrace' adding that there were many 'shortcomings' throughout the police investigation.

She told hosts Holly and Phil via video link from Cyrpus that the only evidence police had was the retracement statement which they had failed to record.

The statement has been disputed by experts who say that it could not have been written by a native English speaker.

The Brit could face up to a year in jail when sentenced tomorrow but could otherwise be handed a suspended sentence alongside a fine.

The young woman's mother was also asked if her daughter would accept a pardon from the Cypriot president.

She said: "Of course in the event she was put into prison, to get out of prison, she would accept a pardon.

"Provided, that would be subject to her not admitting guilt. She is innocent. She was brutally and violently raped by a group of men.

"She will never say she is guilty of this offense."

DAUGHTER'S INNOCENCE

She supported her daughter saying she had 'no doubt' that she was innocent but was worried that her mental health had since been declining on a daily basis.

The student, who hopes to one day become a police officer, is suffering from PTSD and hypersomnia, as her mother claims she has been sleeping for up to 20 hours a day.

She also explained how she was commuting to work when her daughter called to say she had been gang-raped.

She said: "I was thankful, I say this, on a train because quite honestly if I would have been driving a car, I would have crashed it.

"She said, 'Mum, I'm at a police station, I have been raped by a group of boys.

"It was horrendous, it was the worst thing.

"I was shaking, I felt numb, I felt physically sick. It was honestly the worst thing I've ever heard."

10 The woman's identity was hidden to protect her daughter as the hosts questioned her about the case

10 Israeli protesters have stood by the teen and say women's voices are not being heard in cases such as these Credit: AFP or licensors

10 Protests were also carried out in London to show support for the young woman

The British teenager has had a huge amount of support from both British and Israeli activists who say that women's voices are not being heard in cases such as these.

Her mother thanked the girl's family and friends as well as those who have donated to the Go Fund Me page, which has now raised £135,000, and warned others to look at this case before travelling to Ayia Napa.

Talking about comments left online for her daughter, she said: "We read through those, I sit with her on a daily basis, we read through those.

"They are so inspiring they are so motivating, so thank you to anyone that has contributed in any way."



'POSSIBILITY SHE HAD BEEN DRUGGED'

Dr Marios Matsakis, 65, a forensic pathologist, claims the lines of inquiry into the case were not properly investigated, the Mirror reports.

He said:“It’s a possibility she had been drugged. It is another aspect that was not fully explored.”

The woman, from Derbyshire, wanted to be a police officer and had offers from five universities to study criminology and policing.

Her mother told The Times: "She had in mind to be a police officer but she would not be accepted as she wouldn’t have ‘good faith’ if she had to give evidence in court. "

She said her daughter was initially named on Twitter and fears she will never be able to escape the ordeal.

She added: “She sees it as a life sentence — it will always be online. She feels powerless . . . it is like she is being made to go through everything again.”

The teen has faced a traumatic ordeal since first reporting the alleged gang rape.

After telling police of the incident she later retracted her statement under questioning, with cops then claiming she concocted the story after learning video of her having consensual sex was posted online.

One of the men accused of raping the teen has vowed to sue her, sparking fury amongst counsellors and campaigners.

Yona Golub, 18, insists the 19-year-old student "deserves to go to jail" because his life has turned upside down since the rape allegation.

ISRAELI PROTESTS

A group of around 60 Israeli women have said they will protest in support of the British teenager outside the courthouse, on Tuesday.

The demonstrators insist that the young woman is a victim of a gross miscarriage of justice and say they will stand beside her to help overturn her conviction.

Academic Ruhama Weiss, who runs the group, told the Telegraph: "“This case has become a huge issue in Israel. Instead of trying to help the victim, she is being judged and punished. For us, that is intolerable. As Israelis, we want to say that this is not acceptable.

"Just because the boys involved are Israelis and Jews does not mean we should automatically defend them. People in Israel really care about this case and it is all over the media.

most read in news HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery DEADLIEST DAY India suffers record 3,689 Covid deaths as wards and crematoriums overwhelmed 'I'M DISGUSTED' Dad's fury as mum who killed their baby daughter allowed to work with KIDS GOING BALLISTIC Kim Jong-un reacts with fury to Biden's 'big blunder' after security blast MADDIE PROBE Maddie suspect lawyer claims he's 'only in frame as cops think they're smart' SWEAT & TEARS Indian mum, 35, with Covid suffocates in hospital car park waiting for bed

"The people who will take part in the protest are from all different occupations, different ages, many are women but there will also be some men. It was very spontaneous. I had the idea of demonstrating and people immediately started calling me."

Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab also raised concerns about the Brits treatment but added that the government did not want 'aggravate' Cypriots ahead on Tuesday's sentencing.

10 The teen could face up to a year in prison when she is sentenced tomorrow Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 Supporters have been wearing masks that show stitched lips as symbol of silenced woman Credit: Barcroft Media - Getty

10 The hotel room where the woman claimed the assault took place
summary:
She went onto slam Cypriot law as 'wrong' and a 'disgrace' adding that there were many 'shortcomings' throughout the police investigation.
The statement has been disputed by experts who say that it could not have been written by a native English speaker.
The young woman's mother was also asked if her daughter would accept a pardon from the Cypriot president.
She said: "Of course in the event she was put into prison, to get out of prison, she would accept a pardon.
She also explained how she was commuting to work when her daughter called to say she had been gang-raped.

title: Married At First Sight’s Ines says she was ‘suicidal’ and ‘so thin she thought she’d die’ after affair with Sam backlash
text:
MARRIED At First Sight's 'most hated bride' Ines Bašić wanted to take her own life after appearing on the controversial reality show.

The 30-year-old, who had an affair with co-star Sam Ball, said the backlash she endured as her season first aired in Australia in 2019 left her suicidal with her weight plummeting to 41kg.

8 Married At First Sight’s Ines says she was 'suicidal' and ‘so thin she thought she’d die’ after the show

She tells The Sun: “It was real hard. The whole thing… my weight loss was so severe. I dropped down to 41kg (6st 6lb) from 56kg (8st 11lb).

"I was too scared, people were sending me rape and death threats every day.

"I was too stressed to eat and couldn’t stomach anything while it was airing. Once it stopped airing I slowly started getting better."

Ines' mental health first started to deteriorate during filming, after witnessing somebody attempt to take their own life and then finding out that a close friend had suddenly died.

8 Ines told The Sun her weight loss 'was so severe'

8 She became 'the most hated bride' on the reality series

8 The reality star had an affair with Sam who later said he regretted sleeping with her

“I saw someone jump of a balcony [while we were filming on the Gold Coast]. I’d just finished filming at 3am and was a witness and had to call the police. I was screaming and I couldn’t stand up. They survived,” Ines continued.

“Then I had a friend die during filming and [producers] let me have one day off. The show got me a psychiatrist and I was diagnosed with PTSD (post-traumatic stress disorder).”

After leaving MAFS, Ines then spent three months recovering at home – but things got drastically worse as she was then required to film the show's reunion episode, before it then started airing on TV.

8 Ines was matched with Bronson Norrish

8 Ines had an affair with Sam Credit: E4

8 Sam cheated on wife Elizabeth Sobinoff during the experiment

She admits to “over-medicating on valium” while filming the end-of-season reunion - and has no recollection of being there.

Ines added: “There was so much happening and slamming me at once and I was so f***ed. It all happened within a short amount of time and I thought I was going to die. I got so thin I thought I’d die.

“I was suicidal. I was taking valium for my anxiety. I over-medicated before the reunion and shouldn’t have drank. I don’t even remember being there.”

8 Ines said she has been sent death threats following the show Credit: E4

Most read in Celebrity baby joy Ellie Goulding reveals she's given birth to her first baby with husband Caspar 'SOBBING' Kate Garraway hit by a 'white ball of shock' when she saw 'unrecognisable' Derek miss lee Steps singer Lisa Scott-Lee reveals she's working as a headteacher in Dubai mother's day Michelle Keegan enjoys sun-soaked girly day out with her mum noel mention Viewpoint drama 'cut out of ITV interview' with Noel Clarke's co-star GRIEF GROWS Ashley Cain's heartbroken partner Safiyya can't stop thinking about Azaylia

Two years on, Ines is now studying law, a successful fashion and beauty influencer Down Under and trying to remain strong as she endures a fresh backlash from viewers in the UK.

“I want everyone to know I’m a really nice girl, at the time I was just close-minded and it was all filmed two years ago.

"I couldn’t even be that person again if I tried,” she recently told The Sun.
summary:
MARRIED At First Sight's 'most hated bride' Ines Bašić wanted to take her own life after appearing on the controversial reality show.
The 30-year-old, who had an affair with co-star Sam Ball, said the backlash she endured as her season first aired in Australia in 2019 left her suicidal with her weight plummeting to 41kg.
8 Married At First Sight’s Ines says she was 'suicidal' and ‘so thin she thought she’d die’ after the showShe tells The Sun: “It was real hard.
“Then I had a friend die during filming and [producers] let me have one day off.
It all happened within a short amount of time and I thought I was going to die.

title: Man, 47, died in wife’s arms after being punched by gang of teens on way home from pub
text:
A MAN died in his wife's arms after a gang of teens punched him on his way home from the pub, an inquest heard.

David Cameron, 47, suffered a head injury when he fell to the ground after being struck once on the side of his face in Consett, County Durham, on December 5 2019.

3 David Cameron was found seriously injured in Southernwood, in the County Durham town Credit: NCJMedia

3 Floral tributes have been laid for David Cameron Credit: NCJMedia

An inquest at Crook Coroner's Court heard he suffered a heart attack and a "substantial head injury" after the altercation on Southernwood Road at around 5.30pm.

Mr Cameron, a bus driver, was walking home from the pub with his stepdaughter Abbey when the pair passed a group of teen boys, Chronicle Live reports.

A row broke out between him and a 14-year-old and Mr Cameron allegedly pushed the boy before the boy punched him and he fell to the ground.

The inquest heard how neighbours, including Mr Cameron's wife Carol, rushed out of their homes to perform CPR in an attempt to save his life.

A statement read out in court by Senior Assistant Coroner Crispin Oliver said: "The female in the black coat I later found out to be the wife of the man in the road. She said someone had punched him and he had fallen over.

I felt as if I needed to stop him and I just seen the man trip up the kerb and push my friend. He punches him and he dropped. Eye witness

"When David was on his back it was clear he wasn't breathing. David's wife and my son worked together performing CPR."

But despite the efforts of nurse Carol and the emergency services, Mr Cameron was pronounced dead.

One eye witness, who was 14 at the time and cannot be named for legal reasons, said they helped walk Mr Cameron part of the way home with his stepdaughter.

In an interview after the incident, they told police: "We were walking along, we seen a man with his stepdaughter.

"The man fell, he got back up and we passed him, and I heard the stepdaughter shout ‘excuse me can you help’.

"I stopped, turned around and helped the man. I had my arm around and helped him.

"The man was quite drunk. He was struggling to walk and his daughter had her arm around him helping him to walk.

"My friend told us to hurry up, I thought he needed help so I turned around.

"The man was telling my friend to 'shut up and f off'. He seemed angry and wanted to go home.

"He let go of me and the woman and he just walked towards my friend saying 'come on then’.

"His stepdaughter was telling him to stop. Then my friend kept annoying the man so the man just pushed us out the way and was going towards him.

"I felt as if I needed to stop him and I just seen the man trip up the kerb and push my friend. He punches him and he dropped."

'JUST ONE HIT'

In earlier evidence given to the inquest, stepdaughter Abbey said Mr Cameron hadn't deliberately pushed anyone before he was punched.

But the witness told Senior Assistant Coroner Mr Oliver that "there was definitely a push".

They added: "It could have been a possibility that he might have stumbled but I seen his hands go up and my friend getting pushed back."

The witness also told police that Mr Cameron was hit in the face with "quite some force".

They added: "My friend just hits him. One hit. The next thing I know the man’s fallen.

"I heard the woman screaming ‘David’ and she started shouting his name. She was scared, she didn’t know what was happening.

"My friend said he seen the eyes go back and he was scared."

The witness told police the group ran away from the scene before neighbours and emergency services arrived, but that they were left shaken by the incident.

When learning of Mr Cameron’s death, the witness said “our jaws just dropped”.

They told police: “I feel like a horrible person, I shouldn’t have been there in the first place.

"The man looked like he was angry, but I don’t think he would have been able to hurt my friend because of how drunk he was.

"I don't think there was any need for him to hit the man. He could have just walked off and he would have not been able to hurt him."

One of the teens was arrested on suspicion of murder but was later released.

In May 2020, Durham Constabulary released a statement which said: "A teenager who was arrested in connection with the tragic death of a Consett man has been released with no further action.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

"The 14-year-old was arrested on suspicion of murder after 47-year-old David Cameron died following an altercation in Southernwood, Consett, last December.

"Detectives from Durham Constabulary’s Major Crime Team carried out a thorough investigation into Mr Cameron’s death, which included reviewing all of the relevant CCTV footage, completing detailed forensic and pathology work, carrying out house-to-house enquiries and obtaining accounts from all those who witnessed the incident."

The inquest continues.
summary:
A MAN died in his wife's arms after a gang of teens punched him on his way home from the pub, an inquest heard.
A row broke out between him and a 14-year-old and Mr Cameron allegedly pushed the boy before the boy punched him and he fell to the ground.
But despite the efforts of nurse Carol and the emergency services, Mr Cameron was pronounced dead.
"My friend told us to hurry up, I thought he needed help so I turned around.
'JUST ONE HIT'In earlier evidence given to the inquest, stepdaughter Abbey said Mr Cameron hadn't deliberately pushed anyone before he was punched.

title: Animal shelter volunteer Danielle Hopton, 18, beaten to death in parking lot as her ex and another man arrested
text:
AN ANIMAL shelter volunteer was allegedly beaten to death in a parking lot, leading to the arrest of her ex and another man.

Danielle Hopton, 18, was allegedly beaten to death, according to police.

4 Danielle Hopton was just 18 years old Credit: GoFundMe

4 Her ex-boyfriend, Stephen McNeil, was arrested Credit: Larimer County Sheriff's Office

Fort Collins Police received a 911 call about an unconscious, injured woman in a Colorado parking lot.

When officers arrived they reportedly found Hopton "with life-threatening injuries consistent with assault," according to a release obtained by People.

She was rushed to hospital where she later succumbed to her injuries.

Detectives then arrested Stephen McNeil and Ian Rayas, both 20.

The trio drove to Whispering Pines Apartments with a group of friends before Hopton and McNeil, who had been in a relationship, got out of the car to talk.

4 Ian Rayas was also arrested Credit: Larimer County Sheriff's Office

4 Hopton was an animal shelter volunteer Credit: FOX31 / KDVR

McNeil then allegedly assaulted Hopton, leading other members of the group to call the cops as McNeil left the scene, a local CBS affiliate reported.

"Several of the people eventually drove to an apartment complex at 525 E. Drake Road and parked to hang out," police said in a release obtained by People.

McNeil was booked on charges of first-degree murder, a felony, domestic violence, violation of a protection order and violation of bail bond conditions.

Rayas denied knowing both McNeil and Hopton when he was questioned by police, however cops found "evidence to the contrary."

He is facing felony charges of attempt to influence a public servant and accessory to a crime.

According to a fundraising page, Hopton was "a gorgeous, loving, kind and caring young woman."

"She was always smiling and laughing, she was always asking how you are doing and just genuinely cared about others."

The page confirmed that Hopton was a volunteer at an animal shelter and helped her dad raise guide dog puppies.
summary:
AN ANIMAL shelter volunteer was allegedly beaten to death in a parking lot, leading to the arrest of her ex and another man.
Danielle Hopton, 18, was allegedly beaten to death, according to police.
4 Danielle Hopton was just 18 years old Credit: GoFundMe4 Her ex-boyfriend, Stephen McNeil, was arrested Credit: Larimer County Sheriff's OfficeFort Collins Police received a 911 call about an unconscious, injured woman in a Colorado parking lot.
Detectives then arrested Stephen McNeil and Ian Rayas, both 20.
The page confirmed that Hopton was a volunteer at an animal shelter and helped her dad raise guide dog puppies.

title: Monster ‘stabs his pregnant wife to death then kills his step-daughter, 5, when she shielded her mum with her body’
text:
A FIREFIGHTER is accused of stabbing his pregnant wife to death before killing her daughter as she tried to protect her mum.

Konstantin Kapustin, 25, allegedly stabbed new bride Marina Kapustina, 30, and five-year-old Nikol, 25 times with a kitchen knife in Russia.

5 Marina Kapustina died along with her daughter Credit: Roksana Panashchuk

5 Konstantin Kapustin is accused of their murder Credit: Roksana Panashchuk

The horrific incident occurred at the family’s house in the city of Vologda, in the north-west of the country, two weeks after the couple’s wedding.

Kapustin had presented himself as a caring partner but began drinking heavily days after tying the knot, a court was told.

After getting fed up with his drinking, Marina started ignoring him.

A video shows Kapustin saying to detectives: “I came home and she didn’t say hello to me. I got angry. Went to the kitchen and took the biggest knife.”

Kapustin, who reportedly was drunk at the time, is said to have attacked Marina with the weapon in front of little Nikol.

5 Nikol died trying to save her mum Credit: Roksana Panashchuk

5 Marina Kapustina has not long been married to her husband Credit: Roksana Panashchuk

5 The firefighter is facing a life sentence Credit: Roksana Panashchuk

The man hit his wife with the knife seven times and then attacked the child, who had rushed to her mother and shielded her with her body, investigators said.

Kapustin stabbed the girl 18 times before dousing both victims with petrol and setting them alight along with their home while trying to destroy evidence.

Police spokeswoman Natalia Letenkova said: “Examinations showed the victims died from multiple stab wounds to the upper body. The woman was pregnant at the moment of the crime.

“Forensics also said the girl was still alive when the suspect set the house on fire.”

Kapustin confessed to killing the mother and the child during police interrogations, local media report.

Marina Kapustina’s grieving father Mikhail Maklakov said to local media: “I lost my daughter and granddaughter.

“In the whole world, I loved them the most. Now I don't know what to live for.”

He faces up life-sentence in prison if convicted of murder committed with particular cruelty. The trial continues.
summary:
A FIREFIGHTER is accused of stabbing his pregnant wife to death before killing her daughter as she tried to protect her mum.
Konstantin Kapustin, 25, allegedly stabbed new bride Marina Kapustina, 30, and five-year-old Nikol, 25 times with a kitchen knife in Russia.
Kapustin had presented himself as a caring partner but began drinking heavily days after tying the knot, a court was told.
Kapustin stabbed the girl 18 times before dousing both victims with petrol and setting them alight along with their home while trying to destroy evidence.
Police spokeswoman Natalia Letenkova said: “Examinations showed the victims died from multiple stab wounds to the upper body.

title: Ayia Napa Brit’s defence team have just 10 days to appeal to Supreme Court and clear teen’s name – The Sun
text:
THE LEGAL team of British teen convicted of making up gang rape claims against 12 Israelis in Cyprus are now in a race against time to submit an appeal to the island's Supreme Courts.

The woman, 19, boarded a flight back to the UK yesterday after a judge gave her a suspended jail term for “public mischief”.

10 The Brit teen voiced appreciation to hundreds of donors to her legal fund Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 The teenager has flown back the UK after two passengers gave up their seats Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

But despite being given a suspended sentence, the teen has vowed to clear her name with the help of a team of legal experts.

Lawyers now have just ten days to submit an appeal to the Supreme Court of Cyprus and will then wait to see if it has been accepted by a tribunal

A specialist in human rights and part of the teen's defence, Nicoletta Charalambidou, told the Sun Online: "We are preparing to submit an expedited appeal request so that it can be heard within six months.

"We have ten days from the day of sentencing, but will likely use all of them to prepare the ground properly."

After landing back in the UK the young woman was overcome with emotion and told The Sun how she was desperate to enjoy England’s “cold weather”, tuck into a “cheeky Nando’s” and go for walks with her pet dog again.

The woman, who insists she is innocent, vowed: “My fight goes on”.

She and her mother boarded a BA jet from Larnaca to London after two passengers gave up their seats for 550 euros, following an appeal for volunteers by airline staff.

10 Cypriot lawyer Nicoletta Charalambidou said the team had ten days to submit an appeal Credit: AFP or licensors

10 Women's rights activists stood outside the court in support of the British teenager Credit: EPA

In an exclusive interview, she said: “I really thought it would be a custodial sentence when I arrived at court. When the translator said four months, I thought I was going to jail.

“It was only when she said suspended that I realised I was actually finally going home. I looked at my mum and we both had tears in our eyes. I’m so delighted to be going home.”

The teen voiced appreciation to hundreds of donors to her legal fund — many of them loyal Sun readers.

She added: “I want to thank everyone who has supported me. I am innocent and the fight will go on to clear my name.

'A NIGHTMARE'

“It’s been a nightmare for me, mum and everyone. Now I just want to be with my friends and family.

“What kept me going was my family and the amazing support of my friends and all other people who got in contact to say they believed me.

“Now, at last, I can go home to my own bed. I’m even looking forward to the cold weather back in England!

“I can’t wait to have a cheeky Nando’s and to take my dog for a long walk through the countryside.”

The teenager, who has been diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder, was forced to spend nearly five weeks in prison on remand in a cell with up to nine other women.

Even after being granted bail in August, she was kept under virtual house arrest in a villa in the holiday resort of Ayia Napa and had her passport seized.

Her lawyers have already begun work on the appeal. Judge Michalis Papathanasiou suspended her jail term for three years, and ordered her to pay £125 court fees.

He told her he was giving her a “second chance” after last week convicting her despite huge holes in the prosecution’s case.

'VERY AGGRESSIVE'

The judge sparked fury by insisting “all the evidence shows that she had lied”. He dismissed expert defence witnesses as “unreliable” while ruling all prosecution ones “credible”.

Prosecutors also tried to pass off injuries to the woman — said to have been caused when she was held down by her attackers — as “jellyfish stings”.

She told The Sun: “I felt the judge was very aggressive towards me and vindictive. He was misogynistic towards me and my female defence team. They were barely allowed to ask questions and yet the prosecutor had me on the stand for six hours.”

Well-wishers chanted outside the court yesterday and held signs saying, “We Believe You”.

Her ordeal began last summer after she flew to Ayia Napa for a working holiday before university. On July 17 — in floods of tears — she and a pal rushed to tell cops she had been gang-raped by a group of Israelis. Police arrested the 12 suspects aged 16 to 19, but later released them.

MOST READ IN UK NEWS 'MIRACLE' ESCAPE Man falls off 120ft cliff 'taking a selfie' & SURVIVES because tide was in HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home DEAL OR NO DEAL? Nazanin's husband has 'heard nothing' after Iran's claim she'll be freed KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash

Cops then accused her of making up the claims. She was quizzed for eight hours without a lawyer before being ordered to sign a dictated statement retracting her allegations.

Last night the Prime Minister’s official spokesman said: “The Foreign Office will be working with Cyprus and other countries on how we can avoid cases like this happening again.

“We have had numerous concerns about the judicial process in this case.

10 The teen and her mother posed with their suitcases and passports as they prepared to board a flight back to the UK Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 The young woman was photographed with her mother on Tuesday night at the airport in Cyprus Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 She will fly home to the UK after avoiding a jail term Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 The Brit teen was seen leaving court with a face mask showing a pair of lips stitched shut Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

10 The teen told cops she had been gang-raped by a group of Israelis in a hotel room Credit: Jamie Lorriman

10 The teenager says she is desperate to enjoy England’s 'cold weather' again Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

Cyprus rape case – Brit teen free to fly home after being spared jail over Ayia Napa gang rape claim
summary:
The woman, 19, boarded a flight back to the UK yesterday after a judge gave her a suspended jail term for “public mischief”.
"We have ten days from the day of sentencing, but will likely use all of them to prepare the ground properly."
Judge Michalis Papathanasiou suspended her jail term for three years, and ordered her to pay £125 court fees.
Her ordeal began last summer after she flew to Ayia Napa for a working holiday before university.
She was quizzed for eight hours without a lawyer before being ordered to sign a dictated statement retracting her allegations.

title: Schools could BAN hugs in classroom to stop boys ‘overstepping the mark’, suggests former Ofsted chief
text:
A FORMER Ofsted chief who banned hugs in his classroom has suggested schools take similar measures in order to stop boys from "overstepping the mark".

Sir Michael Wilshaw banned hugs in his school while working as a headteacher in 2007, saying the decision was viewed as "too strict" at the time.

4 Sir Michael Wilshaw banned hugs in his classrooms while working as a headteacher in 2007 Credit: ITV

But the former Chief Inspector of Schools in England today insisted it was "the right thing to do" as schools across the country face a Whitehall investigation into the harrowing scale of misogyny, harassment and sexual assault in and around classrooms.

Speaking of his time as the head of Mossbourne Academy in Hackney, London, Sir Michael told Good Morning Britain: “It was seen as the norm for boys when they came into the school to hug girls - there was nothing malicious in it, but they saw that as the norm but of course some over stepped the mark.

"Once I got complaints from girls that some boys were overstepping the mark I banned it."

He said the decision came "at great cost to the school and myself" adding "I was seen as being far too strict and far too authoritarian on this one".

"But looking back now it was absolutely the right thing to do."

Of schoolkids knowing their boundaries, Sir Michael said: "They’ve got to know where the delineating lines are. It’s crucial for headteachers to make clear what is acceptable behaviour towards girls and what is not.”

He added: "Unless head teachers and senior staff set the tone, set the culture, have high expectations, clearly define the parameters for poor behaviour than these sort of things happen.”

SCHOOL SCANDAL

Sir Michael's comments come amid an emerging "rape culture" scandal in Britain's schools, with thousands of pupils coming forward to share their experiences.

Whitehall is probing the issue as police ramp up efforts to tackle gender based violence, after a website 'Everyone's Invited' shone a "light on peer-on-peer abuse within educational settings across the UK."

Simon Bailey, the National Police Chiefs Council's lead for child abuse and investigation said: "Thousands of children and young people have come forward to report allegations of sexual offences within schools".

He added: "We will now work at pace with Everyone's Invited and partners, including the Home Office and Department for Education, to progress a joint response.

A placard saying 'End Rape Culture' attached to the fence outside James Allen's Girls' School

"If victims wish to report sexual abuse to the police, they can be confident that they will be believed and treated with compassion and respect before a thorough investigation is undertaken."

Officials from the Department of Education and Home Office are leading the response along with police chiefs and Ofsted.

And inspectors from Ofsted and the Independent Schools Inspectorate are ready to launch surprise investigations in schools if safety concerns are raised, Whitehall sources told the Telegraph.

Government advice on sexual harassment and sexual violence between kids in schools and colleges is also being revised and will be in force by the beginning of the next academic year, the Telegraph reports.

Sources confirmed that officials from the Government and ministers will be meeting in the coming weeks.

"We take all allegations and concerns about sexual abuse or violence extremely seriously and are working with multi-agency safeguarding partners to ensure the safety of all children in all schools, including in independent schools," the source added.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

"Where schools do not meet the strict safeguarding standards that we have in place, we will always take action.

"If it becomes clear that there are current failings in any school's safeguarding practice, we will immediately ask Ofsted or the Independent Schools Inspectorate to conduct an inspection.

"If a school is found to not be meeting the required safeguarding standard, we will make sure it either improves or closes."

4 Pupils stage a protest against rape culture at Highgate School in London Credit: Reuters

4 Chief Constable Simon Bailey of Norfolk Constabulary has received thousands of online reports Credit: Alamy
summary:
A FORMER Ofsted chief who banned hugs in his classroom has suggested schools take similar measures in order to stop boys from "overstepping the mark".
Sir Michael Wilshaw banned hugs in his school while working as a headteacher in 2007, saying the decision was viewed as "too strict" at the time.
"Once I got complaints from girls that some boys were overstepping the mark I banned it."
And inspectors from Ofsted and the Independent Schools Inspectorate are ready to launch surprise investigations in schools if safety concerns are raised, Whitehall sources told the Telegraph.
"If it becomes clear that there are current failings in any school's safeguarding practice, we will immediately ask Ofsted or the Independent Schools Inspectorate to conduct an inspection.

title: Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek’s feud explained
text:
AMERICAN YouTubers Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek have clashed since her messy breakup with fellow Vlog Squad member Jason Nash in 2019.

The falling out has blown up even further after serious allegations against several of the group's members. Here is everything you need to know about their feud.

6 YouTuber Trisha Paytas has had an ongoing feud with fellow creator Jeff Wittek Credit: INSTAGRAM

6 Jeff is part of the Vlog Squad, whose channel has almost 19million subscribers Credit: INSTAGRAM

What is the feud between Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek?

The drama between Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek began after Trisha mentioned in a YouTube video how one of her ex-boyfriend Jason Nash's friends ignored her in a Starbucks.

Jeff later confirmed it was him and she was furious at his description of the encounter.

He said in a podcast: "I don't have any respect for them. If somebody f**ks over one of my friends, I don't even make eye contact with them.

"I'm not going to see you out and be like, 'Oh hey, how are you doing?' just to avoid that little awkward moment."

Trisha hit back and said Jeff "misconstrued the whole Starbucks thing" - but this was just the beginning.

She went on to claim the Vlog Squad, whose channel has almost 19million subscribers, "ruined her life", adding: "Your f*****g friends are the reason I was in a f*****g mental hospital."

6 Trisha claims the Vlog Squad "ruined her life" Credit: YouTube

Then this month, an explosive article published by Business Insider reported that a woman featured on the Vlog Squad channel was raped by former member Durte Dom in 2018.

Jeff was dragged into the controversy after it was alleged he bought alcohol for underage girls the same night of the alleged sexual assault.

He denies the allegations, but photos show he was there while the victim was carried out of the apartment.

And her friend told Insider she recalls Jeff going out to buy alcohol that same night.

6 The Vlog Squad's Durte Dom has been accused of rape Credit: @durtedom

What has Jeff Wittek said about the allegations?

In a video titled My Truth, Jeff claims the only person who accused him of buying alcohol for minors was Trisha.

He added: "It just makes me angry because it is so not true.

"Trisha and I haven’t been so friendly with each other in the past because of the breakup with Jason [Nash]."

Jeff has said he has donated money to a charity that helps victims of sexual assault, adding that what Dom did was "horrible and disgusting".

He went on to say he had "absolutely nothing to do" with the events that night.

6 Jeff says he had "absolutely nothing to do" with the alleged sexual assault Credit: INSTAGRAM

6 Trisha claims Wittek bought underage girls alcohol on the night of the alleged rape Credit: INSTAGRAM

What's the latest on the feud?

After Jeff's video, Trisha invited him to join her and YouTuber Ethan Klein on their Frenemies podcast.

They questioned whether Jeff had read the article about him - and he admitted he had not.

She also revealed a photo with a timestamp which proved Jeff was present at the time and played a recording which contradicted his story.

Most read in Celebrity baby joy Ellie Goulding reveals she's given birth to her first baby with husband Caspar 'SOBBING' Kate Garraway hit by a 'white ball of shock' when she saw 'unrecognisable' Derek miss lee Steps singer Lisa Scott-Lee reveals she's working as a headteacher in Dubai UPSCALE STACE Stacey Solomon transforms Rex's room with pot of paint in £1.2million mansion mother's day Michelle Keegan enjoys sun-soaked girly day out with her mum noel mention Viewpoint drama 'cut out of ITV interview' with Noel Clarke's co-star

Jeff apologized directly to Trisha for his comments about her time in a mental health facility.

And Trisha, who has 1.43million YouTube subscribers, tweeted that she felt sympathy for Jeff at the moment as he is "going through some stuff".

She added that "he is not slimy like the rest of the group, just trying to cover his bros".

The Sun has contacted Jeff Wittek for comment.
summary:
AMERICAN YouTubers Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek have clashed since her messy breakup with fellow Vlog Squad member Jason Nash in 2019.
6 YouTuber Trisha Paytas has had an ongoing feud with fellow creator Jeff Wittek Credit: INSTAGRAM6 Jeff is part of the Vlog Squad, whose channel has almost 19million subscribers Credit: INSTAGRAMWhat is the feud between Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek?
The drama between Trisha Paytas and Jeff Wittek began after Trisha mentioned in a YouTube video how one of her ex-boyfriend Jason Nash's friends ignored her in a Starbucks.
After Jeff's video, Trisha invited him to join her and YouTuber Ethan Klein on their Frenemies podcast.
The Sun has contacted Jeff Wittek for comment.

title: My lover of six months has a girlfriend – I don’t want to be the other woman
text:
DEAR DEIDRE: MY lover adores me between the hours of 9am and 6pm, then he runs back to his long-term girlfriend.

We met while working at the same DIY store last year. He’s 24, I’m 27.

1 I have been sleeping with my lover for six months but he has a girlfriend, I don't know how to make him commit to me

Everyone knew he lived with his partner, but that didn’t stop him from flirting — he’d regularly find an excuse to come and talk, quizzing me on whether I was single.

It got more intense as the months went on, with him regularly swapping shifts so we could spend more time together.

One shift we were alone in the stock room, sorting through a delivery.

Get in touch with Deidre today My team and I are working safely from home but we are here to help you as always. Send an email to deardeidre@the-sun.co.uk. Every problem gets a personal reply, usually within 24 hours weekdays. You can also send a private message on the DearDeidreOfficial Facebook page. Follow me on Twitter @deardeidre.

He was trying everything and anything to make me laugh — jumping out of boxes and tickling me with the paintbrushes.

We weren’t getting much done so I tried to ignore him, moving further away to unpack another box.

Next thing I know, he’s pushing me up against the wall and kissing me.

It was full of passion — as if he’d been waiting months to do that.

After our shift we didn’t even make it out of the car park and ended up having sex in the back of his car.

AFFECTED BY ASSAULT Are you a bloke struggling to cope after a sex attack? For the support pack Male Rape Victim? email deardeidre@the-sun.co.uk. Read my advice on Facebook, Twitter and at thesun.co.uk/deidre

Six months on and we’re still sneaking around.

We’ll meet each other in the stockroom for a kiss or a fondle whenever we can. But then, at the end of his shift, it’s like I don’t exist.

He goes home to his girlfriend, and won’t text me until he’s leaving for work the next day.

I don’t know if I’m being used as a bit of fun on the side, or whether he actually has feelings for me.

When I do bring up his partner, he quickly changes the conversation, so I have no idea if he has any intention of leaving her.

I feel awful being “the other woman” and have tried to cut it off a few times, but he always pulls me back in.

DEIDRE SAYS: The only person who knows what your lover wants is him – so you need to ask.

But bear in mind that you might not get the answer you want. By not talking about his current relationship, he avoids discussing yours, and it’s likely he’s doing this because he doesn’t think you’ll like what he has to say.

Most read in Dear Deidre DEAR DEIDRE My wife got aroused over a lesbian dream and now I worry it will become reality SO CARELESS Son pays no notice to Covid rules and sleeps around with different women WHO IS HE? Mystery man is sending my wife dozens of text messages every day NEW DESIRES My husband of 33 years no longer turns me on and I want to cheat TIME WASTER Dream guy from dating app has turned out to be a total liar DEIDRE'S PHOTO CASEBOOK Jamie has an unwanted admirer after his split from Emma

If he says he wants to be with you, give him a time limit – he’s got six months, for example, to end his current relationship and commit to you, or you’re moving on.

I’m sending you my support pack Your Lover Not Free to help.

But you can’t continue sneaking around – it’s not fair on his partner, and you risk spreading coronavirus too.

My stepson has been lashing out ever since his father's fatal drug overdose NEXT IN TODAY'S DEAR DEIDRE

READ DEIDRE'S NEW PHOTO CASEBOOK Yvonne tells her tipsy friend to leave after her secret was let out
summary:
DEAR DEIDRE: MY lover adores me between the hours of 9am and 6pm, then he runs back to his long-term girlfriend.
It got more intense as the months went on, with him regularly swapping shifts so we could spend more time together.
Next thing I know, he’s pushing me up against the wall and kissing me.
I don’t know if I’m being used as a bit of fun on the side, or whether he actually has feelings for me.

title: Seattle cops reclaim precinct area from protesters as ‘autonomous zone’ declared ‘unlawful assembly’ after shootings – The Sun
text:
SEATTLE cops reclaimed a precinct area from protesters as the "autonomous zone" was declared an "unlawful assembly" after shootings.

Mayor Jenny Durkan on Wednesday ordered protesters to vacate the East Precinct area of CHOP – or the Capitol Hill Organized Protest zone – with an executive order.

10 Seattle police reclaimed the area of CHOP around the East Precinct Credit: Twitter

10 Cops told demonstrators to vacate the area on Wednesday morning Credit: Twitter

10 Protesters had occupied the CHOP area for around two weeks following the death of George Floyd Credit: Twitter

Protesters have occupied the Seattle area, and barricaded it for around two weeks amid ongoing protests following the death of George Floyd.

Video shared on social media showed Seattle Police pushing through demonstrators in the autonomous zone.

Some police used pepper spray in front of the precinct, KING 5 reported.

Cops clad in increased protective gear were seen holding batons as they pushed back protesters.

As of early Wednesday morning, police said they had made around 10 arrests.

Protesters called for police to leave them alone and chanted as cops moved in.

Seattle Police Department said cops were wearing protective gear "because individuals associated w/the CHOP are known to be armed and dangerous/may be associated with shootings, homicides, robberies, assaults &other violent crimes."

Demonstrators have said they should not be blamed for the violence.

10 Credit: Twitter

10 Cops were seen wearing more protective gear as they pushed crowds of protesters out of the area Credit: Twitter

10 Cops arrived on Wednesday to reclaim the area around the East Precinct Credit: Twitter

10 Credit: Twitter

At 12pm yesterday, Cal Anderson Park was closed – and at 2am on Wednesday, the entire area was closed to "restore public safety," an executive order from Durkan said.

Durkan noted of demonstrations in her order that "much of the expression has been peaceful ad created community solidarity for Black Lives Matter."

She said however, that "conditions in the Cal Anderson Park Area have deteriorated to the point where public health, life, and safety are threatened by activities in and around this area..."

Durkan then noted a number of incidents – including shootings, reports of "rape, robbery, assault, and increased gang activity," and property damage – as she ordered the occupied zone be broken up.

Police Chief Carmen Best said "CHOP has become lawless and brutal."

"Four shootings–-two fatal—robberies, assaults, violence and countless property crimes have occurred in this several block area," Best said.

10 Officers held batons as they moved in lines to push crowds of demonstrators outside the area Credit: Twitter

10 Police said as of early Wednesday morning they had made around 10 arrests Credit: Twitter

10 Mayor Jenny Durkan issued an executive order for protesters vacate the East Precinct area Credit: Twitter

Best said "I support peaceful demonstrations" – but added "enough is enough."

On Monday, a fourth shooting happened inside the occupied zone.

A 16-year-old boy died shortly arriving at the hospital, and a 14-year-old boy was critically injured.
summary:
SEATTLE cops reclaimed a precinct area from protesters as the "autonomous zone" was declared an "unlawful assembly" after shootings.
Mayor Jenny Durkan on Wednesday ordered protesters to vacate the East Precinct area of CHOP – or the Capitol Hill Organized Protest zone – with an executive order.
Video shared on social media showed Seattle Police pushing through demonstrators in the autonomous zone.
Cops clad in increased protective gear were seen holding batons as they pushed back protesters.
10 Credit: Twitter10 Cops were seen wearing more protective gear as they pushed crowds of protesters out of the area Credit: Twitter10 Cops arrived on Wednesday to reclaim the area around the East Precinct Credit: Twitter10 Credit: TwitterAt 12pm yesterday, Cal Anderson Park was closed – and at 2am on Wednesday, the entire area was closed to "restore public safety," an executive order from Durkan said.

title: Sarah Everard: Cop removed from duty for sharing ‘sick WhatsApp about dead woman when guarding murder scene’
text:
A COP guarding the site where Sarah Everard's remains were found was removed from duty for sharing offensive material on social media about her kidnap and murder.

The Met officer is said to have shared the vile material in a graphic with colleagues on a WhatsApp group.

8 Sarah Everard, 33, went missing in south west London Credit: Metropolitan Police

8 Police officers searched Sandwich, Kent earlier today (There is no suggestion of any wrongdoing by the officers in this photo) Credit: PA

Shocked colleagues reported the rookie cop to senior officers and he has been removed from duties at the site and placed on a restricted role.

A high-level internal inquiry has been launched by the Met and the matter has been referred to the Independent Office for Police Conduct.

The Met said tonight: "On Friday 12 March, the Met's Directorate of Professional Standards was made aware of an inappropriate graphic that was allegedly shared via social media by a probationary MPS police constable with some colleagues.

"The sharing of the graphic was reported by a number of these officers who were concerned by its content.

"Given the context of the officer’s duties at the time, a voluntary referral has been made to the Independent Office for Police Conduct in relation to this matter.

"The PC had been deployed as a cordon officer supporting the search operation in Kent in relation to the murder of Sarah Everard.

"The officer has been removed from these duties and placed in a non-public facing role while enquiries continue.

"The graphic does not contain photographic images, no images of Sarah, nor any other material obtained from or related to the investigation into Sarah’s murder.

"Sarah’s family have been made aware of the incident."

8 A marquee set up as Metropolitan Police continue their search near Great Chart, Kent Credit: PA

8 Commissioner Dame Cressida Dick has rejected calls for her to quit Credit: LNP

Assistant Commissioner Nick Ephgrave said: “The MPS expects its officers to behave professionally at all times and this includes how they use social media.

"I take allegations that any officer or officers have failed to observe these standards very seriously and have referred this matter to the IOPC.”

Police today searched a new area in Sandwich, Kent - around 30 miles from where Sarah's body was found.

Officers cordoned off a Co-op car park and a pathway close to woodland as part of the investigation.

Cops today placed a gold necklace found on top of a car park machine in an evidence bag but it is not clear if it is connected to the tragic case.

Others officers with sticks were seen searching through a shopping trolley shelter and under cars in the car park.

Meanwhile specialist police divers waded through a stream next to a pathway as the new search continues.

8 Kate Middleton was among those to pay tribute on Saturday Credit: London News Pictures

8 Police investigating her disappearance are continuing to search an area in Sandwich, Kent today Credit: Steve Finn

It comes after protesters outside Parliament blocked roads and staged a sit-in outside Scotland Yard today as they shouted: "We will not be silenced."

Hundreds of people gathered outside Parliament in London at 5pm for a second day of protest over violence against women.

The Metropolitan Police said in a statement: "A number of groups have gathered in Parliament Square to demonstrate.

"Officers are engaging with those present, urging them not to gather in numbers for their own safety & to prevent the spread of Coronavirus."

Protesters are also opposing a new bill - which is being discussed in Parliament today and tomorrow - which would give police and the home secretary greater powers to crack down on protests.

Under the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill, police forces would be able to impose a start and end time for demonstrations, set a noise limit and shut down protests that have a "relevant impact on persons in the vicinity".

8 Officers arresting one of the protesters Credit: Reuters

8 Demonstrators gathered at Parliament Square tonight Credit: AFP

It comes as the CPS consider charges against two Met cops who allegedly shared grotesque selfies on WhatsApp of the bodies of murdered sisters Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman.

Bibaa, 46, and Nicole, 27, were stabbed to death by a maniac in Fryent Country Park, Wembley, North West London, in June last year.

They had earlier been with a group of friends at a socially-distanced birthday picnic for Bibaa.

The sisters stayed behind when the others left to listen to music and dance with fairy lights.

Their mother, The Venerable Mina Smallman, the first black archdeacon in the Church of England, said the photos taken by the officers had “dehumanised” her daughters.

She told the BBC: “If ever we needed an example of how toxic it has become, those police officers felt so safe, so untouchable, that they felt they could take photographs of dead black girls and send them on.

“It speaks volumes of the ethos that runs through the Metropolitan police.”

The IOPC is investigating six cops who allegedly received or viewed the images of the sisters but failed to report it.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

As a result of the probe, the watchdog is also investigating one officer for taking a photo at the scene of a sudden death elsewhere in North London.

In total, 13 cops from the Met’s North East Command are under investigation from the fall-out of the selfies scandal.

As well as the two cops suspended, five have been placed on restricted duties.
summary:
A COP guarding the site where Sarah Everard's remains were found was removed from duty for sharing offensive material on social media about her kidnap and murder.
"The sharing of the graphic was reported by a number of these officers who were concerned by its content.
"The PC had been deployed as a cordon officer supporting the search operation in Kent in relation to the murder of Sarah Everard.
Cops today placed a gold necklace found on top of a car park machine in an evidence bag but it is not clear if it is connected to the tragic case.
Protesters are also opposing a new bill - which is being discussed in Parliament today and tomorrow - which would give police and the home secretary greater powers to crack down on protests.

title: Bristol protest: Boris Johnson slams Kill the Bill ‘mob’ as 10 arrested after FIREWORKS thrown at cops in latest attacks
text:
BORIS Johnson has today blasted the Kill the Bill "mob" as police arrested 10 protesters following the violent and dramatic clashes in Bristol last night.

Riot cops used shields to push back thousands of booing demonstrators who threw the fireworks along with bottles and eggs at police on the third night of chaos in less than a week.

24 Fireworks were sent flying at police in Bristol as cops arrested 10 protesters Credit: NewsFlare

24 A riot cop holds down a demonstrator during a 'Kill the Bill' protest Credit: Getty

24 It's the third night in a week that protesters took to the streets of Bristol for 'Kill the Bill' demonstrations Credit: Getty

24 A demonstrator falls during a clash with police officers at a protest against a newly proposed policing bill Credit: Reuters

24 Police officers move in on demonstrators in Bridewell Street Credit: PA

The chaotic scenes saw a number of arrests overnight as the protesters and more than 100 cops armed with shields and helmets faced off in the streets.

One of the detained rioters has since been issued a fixed penalty notice while the other nine remain in custody, cops said today.

Boris Johnson called the attacks against officers "disgraceful" giving the city and the police his "full support."

The Prime Minister said today: "Last night saw disgraceful attacks against police officers in Bristol.

"Our officers should not have to face having bricks, bottles and fireworks being thrown at them by a mob intent on violence and causing damage to property.

"The police and the city have my full support."

And the Home Secretary today shamed the 'troublesome' demonstrators, saying: "I am disgusted by the disorder in Bristol and the violence being directed towards the police.

"I’m in no doubt the silent, law-abiding majority will be appalled by the actions of this criminal minority.

TEN ARRESTED

"Despite repeated warnings to disperse, it’s clear these thugs were only intent on causing trouble. I am receiving regular updates and the police have my full support."

Around 1,000 people had gathered in Bristol on Friday night with fears that the scenes would descend into violence after two confrontations in the city already this week.

The protests have been sparked after a new policing bill which would see protests criminalised when deemed a "public nuisance"

And chaos kicked off quickly yet again with fireworks sent flying towards a police horse during the scuffles as cops tried to move on the protesters.

Fears of protesters arming themselves were also sparked with reports that a group of six men had been spotted in the crowd wearing knuckledusters just years away from the police station.

And the demonstrators were heard screaming "no" as the dramatic scenes once again took place on the streets.

Avon and Somertset Police said projectiles including eggs and glass bottles had been lobbed at cops.

In a tweet, they said: "We will not tolerate violent disorder. Arrests have been made."

But activists, who had earlier staged a sit-down demonstration outside Bristol’s Bridgeway police station, retreated just metres as they refused to give up ground.

Officers warned protesters force would be used - with mounted officers on horses and dogs on standby.

24 The Home Secretary today called the protesters 'thugs' who were 'intent on causing trouble'

24 Fireworks were thrown at police as they charged on horses throughout the city Credit: Twitter

24 A protester is held down by a riot police officer Credit: ANDREW LLOYD

24 Police officers detain a man as they move in on demonstrators in Bristol Credit: PA

24 Demonstrators scuffle with police in Bristol city centre Credit: SWNS

24 Protesters sit in front of police officers on Bridgewell Street Credit: PA

24 Riot police and protesters clash Credit: ANDREW LLOYD

The baying crowd chanted “shame on you” as they were pushed back.

Other protesters were spotted with shopping bags full of alcohol after police put a restriction on city-centre shops from selling alcohol.

Earlier police formed a ring of steel around Bridewell Police Station, which was attacked in previous carnage.

The protests have been held in Bristol over the past week, protesting against the Government's Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill.

And during Friday's demonstrations protesters could be heard chanting "ten years for protest, five years for rape" and "justice for Sarah", referring to the recent murder of Sarah Everard in London.

It comes after demonstrations on Sunday and Tuesday had also started peacefully before descending into assaults against police and acts of vandalism.

24 Many protesters held daffodils and chanted 'peaceful protest' Credit: Reuters

24 One protesters shouted at police as people gathered in Bristol Credit: Reuters

24 Others held placards saying 'Kill the Bill' and 'Tories Out' Credit: Reuters

24 Protesters gathered in Bristol for a third night this week Credit: Reuters

24 Riot police greeted the activists at the scene following previous violence Credit: SWNS

24 A march started in Bristol city centre on Friday evening Credit: Getty

24 Riot police lined the streets to keep the protest contained Credit: Reuters

Avon and Somerset Police is currently investigating assaults on 40 officers and one member of the media by thugs at the previous demos.

A total of 24 people have so far been arrested in connection with the disorder, which saw officers attacked, police vehicles set on fire and the windows of a police station smashed.

Police had urged people not to attend any protests because public gatherings are not currently permitted under coronavirus legislation.

Superintendent Mark Runacres said: “The majority of people acted peacefully however there was a minority who once again showed hostility to officers.

“Items, including glass bottles and bricks were thrown at officers, fireworks were launched at our mounted section while one of our horses was also covered with paint.

“This violent conduct is not acceptable.

“Officers repeatedly encouraged people to disperse but once the atmosphere changed and people became physical it was necessary to take action.

“Ten people were arrested for offences including violent disorder, assaulting an emergency worker and possession of Class A drugs.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

“Three of those arrested were also detained in connection with the violent disorder which took place in Bristol on Sunday.”

Supt Runacres added: “All the officers policing the incident are specially trained and accredited in public order and showed exceptional patience in the face of a significant disorder.

“At times reasonable force had to be used – this is not something we ever want to do but we have a duty to uphold the law, prevent crime, and protect people and property.”

24 Police moved protestors who blocked tram lines Credit: LNP

24 Protesters also clashed with police on Tuesday night

24 Riot police were called to deal with crowds at College Green Credit: LNP

24 Violence erupted in Bristol for the second time in three days on Tuesday

24 Two women protesters were removed from the scene Credit: LNP
summary:
BORIS Johnson has today blasted the Kill the Bill "mob" as police arrested 10 protesters following the violent and dramatic clashes in Bristol last night.
Boris Johnson called the attacks against officers "disgraceful" giving the city and the police his "full support."
The Prime Minister said today: "Last night saw disgraceful attacks against police officers in Bristol.
The protests have been held in Bristol over the past week, protesting against the Government's Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill.
“Items, including glass bottles and bricks were thrown at officers, fireworks were launched at our mounted section while one of our horses was also covered with paint.

title: Nicholas Reardon named as cop who killed Ma’Khia Bryant, 16, as he’s put on paid leave during probe
text:
THE white cop who allegedly killed a 16-year-old has been put on paid leave while the shooting is probed.

The teen, named by family as Ma'khia Bryant, was killed by a cop in Ohio moments before Chauvin was found guilty of murdering George Floyd.

17 Ma'Khia Bryant, 16, was fatally shot by police, her family said Credit: Facebook

17 A cop stood nearby where the person lay on the ground Credit: Facebook

17 Graphic bodycamera footage shows a female being shot by a cop seconds after police arrived on scene

17 Hazel Bryant is seen after her niece, Ma'khia Bryant, was fatally shot by a cop on Tuesday Credit: Reuters

17 The victim was transported to the hospital in critical condition, but was pronounced dead Credit: Reuters

17 Protestors immediately gathered after word of the police-involved shooting emerged Credit: Reuters

17 Black Lives Matter demonstrators are seen at the corner of Legion Lane in Columbus, near where Ma'khia was fatally shot Credit: AP

17 The shooting happened just moments before Derek Chauvin's guilty verdict was revealed Credit: Reuters

Graphic bodycam footage of the shooting was last night released by officials.

Cops say they were called to the scene by a person who said someone was trying to stab them at 4.32pm, with officers arriving on scene minutes later at 4.44pm

Video showed two girls arguing before a cop shouted "Get down" and began firing his weapon multiple times at one of them – just seconds after arriving on-scene.

The white cop, who was identified as Nicholas Reardon, has been placed on administrative leave while police investigate if his actions were justified, Police Chief Michael Woods told The Columbus Dispatch.

Reardon was hired by the force in December 2019.

It comes as:

17 Ma'Khia (left) called cops because she was being abused by someone at the foster home she lived at, her aunt claimed Credit: Facebook

17 Police are seen at the scene where the teen was shot Credit: WTTE

17 Demonstrators stood near the scene where the teen was fatally shot Credit: WBNS

17 Black Lives Matter protesters were seen shortly after word of the girl's death emerged Credit: WBNS

17 Video shared on social media showed a body on the ground Credit: Facebook

Hazel Bryant, who said she is Ma'khia's aunt, said her niece called police because she was being abused by someone at the foster home where she lived, The Daily Beast reported.

She told The Columbus Dispatch that her niece got into an altercation with someone else who lived at the same home.

Hazel claimed that Ma'khia had a knife – and although she dropped it, she was shot multiple times, reports The Columbus Dispatch.

"She didn’t deserve to die like a dog in the street," Bryant said, as reported by The Daily Beast.

Ma'khia's mom, Paula Bryant, described her daughter as a "sweet child" who was on the honor roll at school.

"She was a very loving, peaceful little girl," Paula Bryant told WBNS.

She added: "Ma'Khia had a motherly nature about her. She promoted peace."

"That's something that I want to always be remembered."

“Ma’Khia had a motherly nature about her. She promoted peace,” said the 16 year-old girl’s mother, Paula. pic.twitter.com/vhBauZn3Kc — Lacey Crisp (@LaceyCrisp) April 21, 2021

Police responded to reports of an attempted stabbing, WSYX reported.

A victim was taken to a nearby hospital in critical condition, but was pronounced dead just before 5.30pm.

Social media reports initially said that the victim was a 15-year-old black female.

Video shared on social media apparently showed a person lying on the ground as police sood nearby.

The Columbus Police Department did not respond to The Sun to confirm details on the victim.

17 The incident in Ohio broke out just before Derek Chauvin was found guilty of murdering George Floyd Credit: Handout

17 Credit: Twitter/ @MayorGinther

17 Police did not immediately respond to The Sun to confirm details on the victim's identity Credit: WTTE

Columbus Mayor Andrew Ginther said in a series of tweets that details are not all known at this time, but cops were wearing body-cameras.

"This afternoon a young woman tragically lost her life. We do not know all of the details," Ginther said in a tweet.

"There is body-worn camera footage of the incident. We are working to review it as soon as possible. BCI is on the scene conducting an independent investigation . . .

"— as they do with all CPD-involved shootings," he continued in a separate tweet.

"We will share information that we can as soon as it becomes available.

"I’m asking for residents to remain calm and allow BCI to gather the facts."

17 The Ohio Bureau of Criminal Investigation is investigating the police-involved shooting Credit: WBNS

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

Officials with The Ohio Bureau of Criminal Investigation are investigating the shooting.

Shortly after word of the shooting, protesters gathered in the area.

The shooting happened just as ex-Minnesota cop Derek Chauvin was found guilty of second-degree murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter in the death of George Floyd.
summary:
THE white cop who allegedly killed a 16-year-old has been put on paid leave while the shooting is probed.
The teen, named by family as Ma'khia Bryant, was killed by a cop in Ohio moments before Chauvin was found guilty of murdering George Floyd.
The white cop, who was identified as Nicholas Reardon, has been placed on administrative leave while police investigate if his actions were justified, Police Chief Michael Woods told The Columbus Dispatch.
Hazel claimed that Ma'khia had a knife – and although she dropped it, she was shot multiple times, reports The Columbus Dispatch.
"She didn’t deserve to die like a dog in the street," Bryant said, as reported by The Daily Beast.

title: Former UFC octagon girl Lindsey Pelas at war with Instagram over female nudity censorship after sexy posts are removed
text:
LINDSEY PELAS has declared war on Instagram for 'discriminating' against women.

The former UFC ring girl called out the social media site after one of her busty selfies was removed.

9 Lindsey Pelas could not believe that Instagram decided to remove this image Credit: Instagram

9 The American model shared this screenshot to her Twitter page Credit: Instagram

Pelas - who has natural 30HH boobs - has racked up more than 8.6million followers on her Instagram page.

But the 29-year-old was left furious after one of her pictures was taken down for breaching the guidelines.

In the image, Pelas posed for the camera as she showed off her cleavage in a skimpy black top.

She covered her modesty - but Instagram decided to remove it for 'nudity or sexual activity'.

Pelas shared the snap to her Twitter page and wrote: "This photo got removed on @Instagram I guess you can't be naked and you also can't be hot. Lmfao."

During an interview with TMZ, Pelas accused the social media site of promoting rape culture.

She said: "Instagram has been pretty consistently discriminating against women's businesses and women's bodies.

"It's been really particular about showing so much skin surface and the type of wardrobe.

9 The model previously worked as a ring girl for the UFC

9 Lindsey Pelas gained a history degree from Louisiana State University Credit: Instagram

9 The former PlayBoy model was dating Calum Best Credit: Instagram

9 Lindsey Pelas loves to bombard her social media followers with sexy snaps Credit: Instagram

Most read in Sport Live Blog SELBY VS MURPHY Comeback charge from Selby sees him square it at 6-6 after Murphy led early Live Blog MAN UTD VS LIVERPOOL Match POSTPONED after protesting fans invade Old Trafford pitch 'Dangerous' Police condemn Man U fans' protest with officer hospitalised by 'bottle attack' Latest RED FURY Cop slashed in face with bottle as Man Utd fans storm Old Trafford in Glazer demo Latest PROTEST CHAOS Fuming Man Utd fans BLOCK players from leaving Lowry Hotel for Liverpool game Video SKY ALERT Man Utd fans hurl flare at Sky panel as Souness says they could've been 'killed'

"You can actually go and look at Instagram and Facebook policies and they show examples of what they believe to be sexually suggestive.

"One of them is a woman sitting on a bed in underwear.

"The issue is when you decide that something is sexually suggestive, instead of a woman deciding that she wants to have sex with you, it's promoting rape culture.

"You can't just say, 'Oh if she wore a mini skirt she deserves to be raped', that's rape culture."

The ex-girlfriend of Calum Best urged the government to step in to sort out the ongoing issue.

Before she added: "I think we are far behind on cyber legislation and our digital laws do not mirror the laws we have in place in our physical lives.

"I think it's really important that our government notices that and takes note of it.

"We have these laws that we have to live and abide by and pay taxes on in a society that we support and we live that way, but then online it's lawless and people can do whatever they want and they can cherry pick.

9 Lindsey Pelas claimed she'd 'never' have surgery to reduce her natural size 30HH boobs Credit: Getty Images - Getty

9 Lindsey Pelas has been hailed the 'hottest woman in the world' by GQ and Maxim Credit: Instagram

"They decide what you wear and decide who can win - that's the opposite of democracy and you just have to wonder why it has not been done yet."

Pelas grew up in Louisiana and graduated at the Louisiana State University with a bachelor’s degree in history.

She has featured in the likes of Maxim, GQ, Glamour and modelled for PlayBoy on several occassions.

And she caused a storm when she made her UFC ring girl debut in 2016 at the Palms Casino in Las Vegas.

9 The stunner has accused Instagram of discriminating against women Credit: Getty - Contributor
summary:
LINDSEY PELAS has declared war on Instagram for 'discriminating' against women.
The former UFC ring girl called out the social media site after one of her busty selfies was removed.
In the image, Pelas posed for the camera as she showed off her cleavage in a skimpy black top.
She covered her modesty - but Instagram decided to remove it for 'nudity or sexual activity'.
And she caused a storm when she made her UFC ring girl debut in 2016 at the Palms Casino in Las Vegas.
