title: Suspects probed over gang-rape of Brit girls are rappers who sing ‘b*****s, unbuckle my belt’ in music video
text:
TWO rappers are being investigated over the gang-rape of two British girls in Italy, it emerged today.

The well-known trap artists rapped 'b***h, unbuckle my belt' in a music video released weeks before the attack.

9 Rappers Michele Leone and Egidio Andriulli have been added to the register of suspects Credit: YouTube

9 It is not clear whether the two trap artists were directly involved in the attack Credit: YouTube

9 CCTV footage shows the group of men heading towards the field and then coming back Credit: AP:Associated Press

The victims, two 15-year-old British schoolgirls, went to a party at a villa in Marconia di Pisticci, in the province of Matera, where they were allegedly raped by eight men the night between September 7 and September 8.

The girls said shortly after they arrived at the party, they were taken to a field nearby, where they were raped for about 15 minutes by a group of men.

CCTV footage released by police showed the suspects heading towards the field and coming back shortly after, attempting to leave the villa.

Michele Masiello, 23, Alberto Lopatriello, 22, Alessandro Zuccaro, 21, and Giuseppe Gargano, 19, who were named and pictured by Italian media, were arrested and are being held in jail in Matera.

'BRUTAL ASSAULT'

Local rappers Michele Leone and Egidio Andriulli, known on YouTube as Red Michael and Meu Deus, have also been added to the register of suspects, Italian national newspaper La Repubblica reports.

It is not clear whether the two trap artists, who are being investigated, were directly involved in the attack. The newspaper says that prosecutors have named them.

In their latest song 'Conto Cash' - which translates to 'I count my cash' - they rap: "I count money in my Mercedes, two b*****s on board, we go for a ride."

The song continues: "These two b*****s undo my belt."

Witnesses who were at the party confirmed the rappers were at the villa at the time of the alleged rape.

They reportedly arrived there with the four men who were arrested and are currently in jail, according to Virgilio.

Red Michael, a rapper online and an engineer in real life, is said to be the son of a police officer.

9 Michele Masiello, 23, is one of the suspects Credit: .

9 Alessandro Zuccaro, 21, is one of the arrested men Credit: .

9 Giuseppe Gargano, 19, is one of the four men held at a jail in Matera Credit: .

9 Alberto Lopatriello, 22, was also arrested on suspicion of rape and wounding Credit: .

The organiser of the party said an invitation was published on Facebook, which is why many people joined in.

He said: "We were wrong in publishing the invite on Facebook and send it to some WhatsApp groups, but we could not have imagined [what happened].

"The party was going well until at some point I saw the boys from Pisticci arrive.

"Everyone knows them here, they are a bit degenerate, even though some of them come from good families."

He added: "When I saw them arrive, I wondered what they were doing here. But then they disappeared.

"When we were serving the cake, the uncle of one of the British girls arrived and started talking.

"It was only then that we understood what had happened."

One of the victims said she had the impression one of the men was trying to film the attack on his phone.

She said: "I told them to stop. I was shouting in English let me go.

"They took off their trousers and I tried to defend myself by biting the penis of one.

"I saw that one of them was trying to film it on his phone.''

9 Four men were arrested and are being held in jail Credit: AP:Associated Press

9 A banned was hung in front of the town hall. It reads 'We are not all the same. Our community asks your forgiveness' Credit: TGcom24

Following the rape, the victims told the sister of one of them what happened, then they returned home and called the emergency services.

The girls were taken to Madonna della Grazie hospital in Matera for a health assessment, according to reports.

The two victims, who were in a state of shock, reported the incident to police, saying they had been punched before being raped, TGcom24 reports.

Officers described the rape as a ''brutal and extreme assault''.

The investigation revealed that the uncle of one of the girls was told by guests ''don't call the police or you will ruin the party'' when he went to the villa after the attack.

One of the girls described in her statement how she ordered a drink from a barman and was then offered a second by a man she met at the party.

She said: ''I didn't knowingly take any drugs but I think someone put something in my second drink because after I drank it I felt awful.''

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

A banner was hung from the town hall with the slogan ''We are not all the same. Our community asks your forgiveness.''

Both girls are still in Italy where a fast track trial is due to take place this week.

All four of those arrested on suspicion of sexual violence and wounding deny the charges and claim the girls consented.
summary:
TWO rappers are being investigated over the gang-rape of two British girls in Italy, it emerged today.
The well-known trap artists rapped 'b***h, unbuckle my belt' in a music video released weeks before the attack.
Witnesses who were at the party confirmed the rappers were at the villa at the time of the alleged rape.
9 Michele Masiello, 23, is one of the suspects Credit: .
9 Alessandro Zuccaro, 21, is one of the arrested men Credit: .

title: Boris Johnson pays tribute to family of George Floyd as he ‘welcomes’ guilty verdict for killer cop Derek Chauvin
text:
BORIS Johnson has paid tribute to the family of George Floyd as he "welcomed" a guilty verdict for killer cop Derek Chauvin.

It came as the Minneapolis police officer, 45, was found guilty of second-degree murder, third-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter and faces a maximum sentence of 75 years in jail.

16 Boris Johnson has paid tribute to the family of George Floyd Credit: Reuters

16 Mr Johnson said he was 'appalled' by the death of George Floyd Credit: Twitter

16 Chauvin knelt on Floyd’s neck for nine minutes and 29 seconds Credit: Handout

After the verdict, the Prime Minister said he was "appalled" by the death of Floyd last year.

He tweeted: "I was appalled by the death of George Floyd and welcome this verdict.

"My thoughts tonight are with George Floyd’s family and friends."

My thoughts tonight are with George Floyd’s family and friends. Boris Johnson

Mr Johnson's tribute came as US President Joe Biden called the conviction a a "giant step forward" in tackling racism in the US.

He branded Floyd’s death a “stain on our nation’s soul” and called his relatives a “remarkable family of extraordinary courage”.

Biden said: “It was a murder in full light of day, and it ripped the blinders off for the whole would to the systemic racism...that's a stain on our nation's soul.”

The president added: “Nothing can ever bring their brother back. But this can be a giant step forward in the march toward justice in America.”

16 Joe Biden branded Floyd’s death a 'stain on our nation’s soul' Credit: Reuters

Chauvin knelt on Floyd’s neck for nine minutes and 29 seconds while arresting the 46-year-old trucker in May 2020, killing him after he had repeatedly yelled out: “I can’t breathe.”

He now faces a maximum 40 years in jail on the most serious charge, plus 25 years and ten years in prison on the other two.

The shamed officer, wearing a suit and face mask in court, showed no emotion as the verdicts - guilty on all counts - were read aloud by Judge Peter Cahill.

His bail was revoked and he was cuffed and led down to the cells – as cheers erupted from outside the courthouse.

16 Derek Chauvin faces up to 75 years in prison Credit: Reuters

16 Chauvin was taken into custody as his attorney Eric Nelson, left, watched Credit: AP

At George Floyd Square, the memorial where Floyd was killed, a woman nearly collapsed in tears, crying out: “We matter. We matter.”

Chants of "justice" and "black lives matter" were heard thundering out.

At the intersection where Floyd was pinned down, a crowd chanted, “One down, three to go!” — a reference to the three other fired Minneapolis police officers facing trial in August on charges of aiding and abetting murder in Floyd’s death.

The US had been braced for violence before the jury’s decision, with fears that not guilty verdicts could spark the violent unrest seen last May following Floyd’s death.

More than 3,000 National Guard troops and 1,100 extra cops were drafted into Minneapolis, while the courthouse was ringed with concrete barriers and razor wire.

16 People felt emotional after the verdict Credit: The US Sun

16 Floyd family attorney Ben Crump and Philonise Floyd raise their fists during a news conference following the verdict Credit: Reuters

16 People took to the streets to pay tribute to Mr Floyd and show their support for the verdict Credit: Reuters

US President Joe Biden, speaking just hours before the jury came back, said he was “praying” for the “right verdict”.

He said: “The evidence is overwhelming in my view.”

Speaking from the White House, he added: “I’ve come to know George’s family. I can only imagine the pressure and the anxiety they’re feeling. They’re a good family and they’re calling for peace and tranquility.”

Floyd's brother, Philonise Floyd, added that Biden – who lost his wife and young daughter in a car crash, as well as his eldest son, Beau, to cancer - “knows how it is to lose a family member”.

He added: “He was just letting us know that he was praying for us and hoping that everything would come out to be ok.”

16 Joe Biden spoke to George Floyd's family after the verdict Credit: AP

President Biden, vice president Kamala Harris and First Lady Jill Biden called members of the Floyd family moments after the verdict.

In a video posted by Floyd’s lawyer Ben Crump, Biden told the family: “Nothing is going to make it all better, but at least now there is some justice. We're all so relieved.”

Biden said he hoped the verdict would give momentum to police reform efforts in the US.

Prosecutor Jerry Blackwell said the verdict showed that Floyd’s life mattered.

He added: “No verdict can bring George Perry Floyd back to us, but this verdict does give a message to his family that he was somebody, that his life mattered, that all of our lives matter.”

George Floyd's girlfriend, Courteney Ross, called Tuesday a "huge day for the world".

She told CNN: "We’re finally starting to see. We walked around with eyes wide shut for a long time, so they’re starting to open today, and this is going to be the first in a future of change.

"For me, it means that my friends and people that have also lost loved ones now have a chance to get their cases reopened."

16 George Floyd's girlfriend Courteney Ross said Tuesday was a 'huge day for the world' Credit: Reuters

16 George Floyd died after pleading that he couldn't breathe Credit: Facebook

16 George Floyd with his little daughter Credit: Reuters

16 Gianna Floyd, the daughter of George Floyd, walks towards the entrance of the the courthouse with her family Credit: Rex

On Monday, the jury was ordered to begin considering its verdict on charges of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter.

The jury – made up of six white, four black and two mixed race people - deliberated for four hours on Monday, before continuing for six hours yesterday.

The second-degree murder count carries a maximum 40-year sentence, the third-degree murder charge 25-years and ten years in jail for the second-degree manslaughter.

Chauvin will be sentenced at a later date, Judge Peter Cahill said.

Floyd had been arrested after producing a fake banknote at a store in Minneapolis last May.

His shocking death – captured in gruesome bystander video – sparked Black Lives Matter protests around the world.

Prosecutors rested their case on Monday, following a three-week trial, by claiming Floyd died because Chauvin’s heart “was too small”.

They said Chauvin “had to know” that he was squeezing the life out of Floyd.

Prosecutor Steve Schleicher, referring to the video of Floyd pinned to the pavement, told jurors to “believe your eyes”.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

He added: “Use your common sense. What you saw, you saw.”

The trial judge Peter Cahill later claimed that a Democratic politician, Maxine Waters, may have recklessly given Chauvin grounds to appeal.

The Californian congresswoman visited Minneapolis this week and urged protestors to stay on the streets and “get more active” and “more confrontational” if the verdict was not guilty.

16 People hug after the verdict in the trial Credit: Reuters

16 People have taken to the streets after former cop Chauvin was found guilty Credit: The US Sun
summary:
BORIS Johnson has paid tribute to the family of George Floyd as he "welcomed" a guilty verdict for killer cop Derek Chauvin.
It came as the Minneapolis police officer, 45, was found guilty of second-degree murder, third-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter and faces a maximum sentence of 75 years in jail.
"My thoughts tonight are with George Floyd’s family and friends."
My thoughts tonight are with George Floyd’s family and friends.
He branded Floyd’s death a “stain on our nation’s soul” and called his relatives a “remarkable family of extraordinary courage”.

title: The horrific true story of the ‘Skopin Maniac’ who raped teenage girls in his concrete dungeon for nearly four years
text:
VIKTOR Mokhov's teenage sex slaves were starved, beaten and raped in a squalid cell for three-and-a-half years – now he's out.

And the 70-year-old monster has caused new outrage by saying he'd like to take one of his victims back in an interview with journalist alleged to be Putin's god-daughter.

16 Viktor Mokhov, 70, was sentenced to 17 years for raping teenage girls in a bunker he built under his garage in Skopin, Russia Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

Mokhov became known as the "Skopin Maniac" for his horrific imprisonment and rape of Ekaterina Martynova and Elena Samokhina, who were 14 and 17 years old respectively when he abducted the pair as they left a disco in 2000.

During their nightmare ordeal, Samokhina gave birth to two babies in the dungeon – Mokhov took the infants and abandoned them in the stairwells of apartment buildings.

16 Ekaterina Martynova - pictured last year - was just 14 years old when she was abducted Credit: Newsflash

16 Elena Samokhina was 17 - they were taken as they were returning home from a disco in 2000 Credit: Newsflash

Samokhina had a third, stillborn baby after she and Martynova were freed after nearly three years in May 2004.

Now in a highly controversial interview, which is already being investigated by Russian authorities, Mokhov was given airtime to justify his crimes in a chat with prominent journalist Kseniya Sobchak.

16 The girls were filmed on their release from the hell hole Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

16 Samokhina gave birth to two babies in the dungeon Credit: Newsflash

16 The entrance down into the hellhole bunker is now blocked off Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

"She gave birth from me but not any more," Mokhov says of Samokhina in the interview.

"I must take her on again.”

Abducted and drugged

Samokhina and Martynova weren't even the first girls subjected to Mokhov's horrific depravity.

In 1999, former mining college student Mokhov lured a 16-year-old and her boyfriend to his home in Skopin, around 150 miles south of Moscow.

16 Mokhov was an auto parts factory worker who'd studied mining, giving him the skills to make the bunker Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

16 The girls were rescued from a dungeon located deep under Mokhov's garage Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

He plied them with alcohol but the teenage girl resisted his advances – after she tried to leave, he dragged her to his bunker and raped her.

She managed to escape after two weeks when he didn't lock the bunker properly, but she didn't report the incident to the police for fear Mokhov would find her.

Less than a year later, the rapist spotted Martynova and Samokhina leaving a disco and offered them a lift.

Seeing Mokhov's girlfriend Yelena Badukina was also in the car, the teenagers thought they'd be safe.

16 Yelena Badukina helped abduct the girls and went to jail for the crime - she knew about Mokhov's sick plans, but not about the bunker

16 Katya Martynova has spoken of her fear about Mokhov's release from jail Credit: East2West

They got in and were offered vodka – which they didn't know was mixed with sedatives.

Soon they found themselves inside a dingy concrete bunker seven metres underground, locked behind steel, bolted doors.

The bunker was split into three sections, including a living space furnished with a bed and table, and a room with pornographic images plastered on the walls where Mokhov would rape the girls one at a time.

They were trapped – and would be for nearly four years.

Locked deep underground

Down in the dark, Mokhov subjected them to unimaginable suffering.

When they resisted his sex attacks, he would punish the girls by starving them for days, cutting them with a knife, or even spraying tear gas into the dungeon.

16 The bunker was hidden beneath the garage at Mokhov's home where he lived with his mother Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

He'd also threaten to turn off the electricity and ventilation system, choking them of breathable air and plunging them into the freezing cold.

Under the thick concrete walls, no one outside could hear cries for help.

Mokhov would conversely reward them for compliance, bringing them books, music cassettes and paints, the latter of which they used to daub a sun on the grey concrete of their cell.

"It's hard to realise that you are underground and do not know when this will all end. Therefore, at first we cried a lot and often," Martynova told Meduza.

16 The room which led into the living space was sealed behind a thick steel door

"Over time, not that we got used to it and resigned ourselves, but understood that we must live. We began to draw up a daily routine: cooking, eating, watching TV, I was drawing, Lena was studying English."

Samokhina also gave birth to two sons, delivered by Martynova, in the dank dungeon.

Mokhov knew the babies would die in the bunker, so he secretly abandoned them in places he knew they'd be found and taken to orphanages.

Eventually, Mokhov grew dissatisfied and wanted a new victim in his harem – a medical student who was lodging in his house.

16 The girls decorated the bunker with drawings and posters on the walls Credit: AFP

By 2003, he'd been taking Martynova into an upper chamber of the bunker for fresh air, which signalled a loosening of security after keeping the girls in a six-metre-square cell for years.

He would also sometimes let her into the house to wash in a bath, as opposed to relying on the buckets of water he normally brought into the bunker.

He ordered Martynova to pretend to be his niece in a bid to convince the lodger to stay – but instead, Martynova secreted a note inside a cassette tape which she gave to the student to warn her of the mortal danger she was in.

The student fled and contacted the police, who quickly found and freed the captives.

'Lonely hell'

Officers filmed the moment they found the girls who'd been presumed dead for years.

"They did try to escape but they failed and were scared he would beat them so over time they became resigned to their fate," Major Igor Shelestiuk of the Russian Interior Ministry told the press shortly after their release.

"The girls almost got used to their conditions and just waited for the bitter end. They were convinced they would die in that lonely hell."

He added: "God knows how they will ever get over this."

At trial, it emerged that Mokhov had also been living with his mother in the home – who claimed to have no knowledge of the dungeon, or the fact that Martynova was enslaved.

"I wanted to have many children," Mokhov told investigators about his motive. "I wanted to improve the demographic situation of Russia."

Mokhov was sentenced to 17 years in a maximum security penal colony for his crimes.

16 Mokhov would turn off the power to the bunker under his garage to leave the girls in the freezing dark Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

His accomplice, Elena Badukina, was given five-and-a-half years for helping to kidnap the girls.

On March 3 this year, Makhov was released after serving his sentence.

"Such crimes should be given a life sentence," Martynova said earlier this month.

"I have always understood that 17 years will end sooner or later, but now it is hard to believe that he is free."

'A deep wound that won't heal'

Just three weeks on from his release, Russia was outraged by his lengthy interview with Kseniya Sobchak.

Over the course of the programme, which was published on Sobchak's YouTube channel, Mokhov tries to justify his crimes and gives the journalist a tour of the bunker as it is today.

16 Mokhov justified his horrifying crimes in an interview with Kseniya Sobchak Credit: YouTube / Ксения Собчак

He also tells Sobchak that he considered himself a good man who "slipped up a little", adding "who doesn't?", The Times reports.

Sobchak has defended the interview, saying accusations that her report could inspire other crimes were just as true of feature films which show fictionalised horrors.

Sobchak is the daughter of Anatoly Sobchak, the former mayor of St Petersburg who was Putin's mentor before the ex-KGB officer went into politics.

16 Sobchak defended the interview, which has now 4.5million times and has sparked huge backlash in Russia Credit: Reuters

MORE IN NEWS Exclusive TWILIGHT KILLER My twisted sister had sex with her boyfriend after he murdered our family Investigation SOLD FOR SEX Inside Romanian sex trafficking ring where girls are brought to UK to be raped Sexflix Best & worst TV sex scenes - from Normal People's 'real' sex to Bridgerton romps HOUSE OF HORRORS Tragic tale of disabled victims kidnapped, pimped out & fed cockroaches Exclusive 'MATE CRIME' My disabled son was murdered by ‘friend’ who pushed his body around in a pram PROUD PA How Philip made sure his daughters-in-law always felt accepted into the family

She's repeatedly denied that Putin is her godfather, but did admit that he was at her baptism when she was 12.

Mokhov's release has horrified Martynova and Samokhina, both of whom now have families, and they have condemned media outlets giving cash to their tormentor for interviews.

"What happened to me left a deep wound in my soul that will never heal,” Samokhina told Yahoo News.
summary:
VIKTOR Mokhov's teenage sex slaves were starved, beaten and raped in a squalid cell for three-and-a-half years – now he's out.
"I must take her on again.”Abducted and druggedSamokhina and Martynova weren't even the first girls subjected to Mokhov's horrific depravity.
In 1999, former mining college student Mokhov lured a 16-year-old and her boyfriend to his home in Skopin, around 150 miles south of Moscow.
Less than a year later, the rapist spotted Martynova and Samokhina leaving a disco and offered them a lift.
Soon they found themselves inside a dingy concrete bunker seven metres underground, locked behind steel, bolted doors.

title: Biden orders flags at half mast at all US federal buildings worldwide to honor victims of Atlanta shooting
text:
JOE Biden has ordered flags to be lowered to half mast at all US federal buildings worldwide to honor the victims of the Atlanta shooting.

The White House said it was "a mark of respect for the victims of the senseless acts of violence" which killed eight people on Tuesday.

7 Biden has ordered flags to be lowered to half mast at all US federal buildings worldwide Credit: Getty

7 The president said it was "a mark of respect for the victims of the senseless acts of violence" Credit: Reuters

7 Memorial flowers were placed outside Young's Asian Massage salon Credit: Alamy

Biden's order further directed attention to the victims, six of whom were of Asian descent.

South Korea have confirmed that four of the victims were of Korean descent.

Of the eight dead, seven were women and one was a man, according to officials.

In a statement, the president described the crime was "very, very troublesome" but said he would make no comment on the motivation of the shooter until the investigation was complete.

It is not yet clear if it was a racially motivated attack, but cops probing the shooting have said that a "hate crime" is not off the table.

The NYPD announced it will deploy officers into Asian communities in response to he shootings and the rising hate crimes against Asian minorities.

On Wednesday, White House press secretary Jen Psaki said there was "no question" Donald Trump's use of the phrase "Wuhan virus" during the pandemic helped trigger a rise of hate crimes.

7 Most of the victims of the spa shootings were believed to be Asian women Credit: Reuters

At least eight people were killed at three spa shootings in the Atlanta area on Tuesday

A "sex addict" has been charged over the attacks at the massage parlors.

God-fearing Robert Aaron Long, 21, took responsibility for the shootings and told cops that the parlors were a "temptation that he wanted to eliminate".

Long was arrested on Tuesday night after leading cops on a three-hour car chase, Cherokee County Sheriff's spokesperson Howard J Baker said.

And cops have released the chilling 911 calls from when the alleged gunman attacked.

Sheriff Frank Reynolds said in a press conference on Wednesday that Long had potential "sexual addiction" issues.

CNN later reported that a former roommate had claimed the alleged shooter spent time in a sex rehab clinic.

Sheriff Reynolds said that cops believe Long "frequented these places in the past" and that he "may have been lashing out".

They added that Long claimed the attack was not racially motivated.

Robert Long remains in custody

Eight people were dead after shootings at three spas in the Atlanta area

Police also revealed that Long bought a gun on the day of the spa slaughter.

During a Thursday afternoon press briefing, Atlanta police said that he often went to the locations he targeted and bought a firearm the day of the murders.

WHAT WE KNOW SO FAR

Eight people have died in three separate shootings at a range of massage parlors.

The first shooting began at around 5pm on March 16 at the Youngs Asian Massage Parlor.

Two people died at the scene, three casualties were transported to the hospital, where another two also died.

Nearly an hour later, the gunman began another shooting spree in the Buckhead neighbourhood of Atlanta at Gold Spa.

Three women were found dead at the second massage parlor.

A fourth woman was shot dead at Aromatherapy Spa, just across the street from Gold Spa.

Seven of the eight victims were women and six were Asian, police say.

Robert Aaron Long, 21, was arrested after a lengthy police pursuit that saw his black 2007 Hyundai Tuscon rammed off the road.

The first shooting took place at Young’s Asian Massage in Acworth, followed by shootings at the Gold Spa and Aromatherapy Spa in Atlanta.

In the first shooting, two Asian women, one white woman and a white man were killed while three Asian women were then gunned down at Gold Spa, before an Asian woman was shot dead at Aromatherapy Spa.

At around 5pm cops responded to reports of a shooting at Young’s Asian Massage, off Bells Ferry Road and Highway 92 in Acworth, where they found five people with gunshot wounds.

Three people were taken to a hospital, where two of them died.

The Mayor of Atlanta, Keisha Lance Bottoms, praised the quick response of authorities in apprehending the offender and offered her sympathies.

She said: "I commend law enforcement for their quick work in arresting a suspect in the tragic shootings on yesterday.

"A motive is still not clear, but a crime against any community is a crime against us all.

"I have remained in close contact with the White House and APD as they work with federal, state and local partners to investigate the suspect who is responsible for this senseless violence in our city."

Most read in News SICK TROPHY Charles Manson booking sheet from Manson family murders on sale for $95k GRAY ESCAPE Elderly couple use military training in Morse code to bust out of senior home 'COUNTERACTION' Taliban threatens attack after Biden pushed back Afghanistan withdrawal TOUCHDOWN SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts lands in Gulf of Mexico after leaving ISS CASINO HORROR Two dead as gunman opens fire at casino before being shot dead by police Exclusive WORLD'S STRONGEST GRANDMA Powerlifter, 71, hits back at claims she's 'too old' for the gym

Former First Lady Hillary Clinton also shared her condolences.

She wrote: "I’m sending prayers today to the families of the people killed and those injured in Atlanta’s horrific attacks.

"The surge in violence against Asian Americans over the last year is a growing crisis.

"We need action from our leaders and within our communities to stop the hate."
summary:
JOE Biden has ordered flags to be lowered to half mast at all US federal buildings worldwide to honor the victims of the Atlanta shooting.
Sheriff Reynolds said that cops believe Long "frequented these places in the past" and that he "may have been lashing out".
The first shooting began at around 5pm on March 16 at the Youngs Asian Massage Parlor.
Nearly an hour later, the gunman began another shooting spree in the Buckhead neighbourhood of Atlanta at Gold Spa.
The first shooting took place at Young’s Asian Massage in Acworth, followed by shootings at the Gold Spa and Aromatherapy Spa in Atlanta.

title: 100 best Netflix series to watch right now
text:
SELF-isolation and lockdown have made Brits retreat to their homes and stream to their hearts' content like never before.

But distraction is just a click away - look no further for our pick of Netflix's best series to binge on and beat the boredom.

Comedy

1. Orange Is the New Black

96 Follow the life of a thirty something inmate in a federal prison Credit: Netflix

This hit prison series revolved around Piper Chapman (Taylor Schilling), a 30-something woman who is sentenced to 15 months in Litchfield Penitentiary. The minimum-security women’s federal prison in upstate New York and the stories of the other inmates drives the series and you'll soon fall in love with the band of misfits.

With sharp wit, gripping romances and a bleak take on criminal injustice, Orange Is the New Black will take on a roller coaster of emotions.

With seven seasons to binge on, it’s the perfect COVID-19 blackout show to watch.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 81%

2. Atypical

96 The heartwarming journey exploring what it means to be normal Credit: Netflix

A coming of age story that follows 18-year-old Sam (Keir Gilchrist), who is on the autistic spectrum, as he searches for love and independence.

The funny and emotional journey of self-discovery sees Sam's family struggle with questions of what it means to be 'normal' in the 21st century.

Atypical came to an end with its third season back in 2019.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 95%

3. Brooklyn Nine-Nine

96 "Cinco De Mayo" Episode 616 - Pictured: (l-r) Andy Samberg as Jake Peralta, Melissa Fumero as Amy Santiago, Joe Lo Truglio as Charles Boyle Credit: NBC

Brooklyn Nine-Nine follows the lives of a group of detectives in a New York precinct.

Among the bunch is renowned slacker Jake (Andy Samberg) who wants to make the new boss' life as hard as possible.

However, an unexpected friendship blossoms between Captain Holt and the rest of the gang follows suit.

With its blend of slapstick comedy and witty one-liners, this is the perfect feel good watch.

With seven seasons out now, there's plenty to sink your teeth into.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 93%

4. Kim's Convenience

96 Join the eccentric family as they navigate through life Credit: Netflix

The Korean Wave keeps coming with this series.

It follows a Korean-Canadian family who own a convenience store in Toronto.

The family consists of two siblings and their parents who are trying to navigate their way through life.

There are five seasons of Kim's Convenience out now.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 90%

5. The IT Crowd

96 The misfits are IT experts based in the basement of a large corporation Credit: Netflix

This British sitcom shows a group of computer geeks whose careers reside in the basement of a huge company.

The comedic adventures of the rag-tag team of co-workers sees them regularly at odds with the company's boss, who is is technically inept and doesn't know the difference between software and hardware.

If you're new to the show, expect nerdy humour and cringe-inducing situations aplenty.

With four seasons, consider this the perfect feel good binge.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 85%

6. Jane The Virgin

96 Immaculate conception and lots of drama can be expected with this series Credit: Netflix

Telenovelas are a way of life for South Americans and this slice of life drama is no different.

Based on the immaculate conception Bible story, the series follows Jane Villenuva, who is a virgin that is artificially inseminated. With a cop fiancé and her very Catholic grandmother in tow, it shows how her life progresses through her pregnancy and beyond. Throw in a few kidnappings, murders, drug lords and it's the all-rounded telenovela with a Western twist.

There are five seasons of Jane The Virgin available now.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 86%

7. Never Have I Ever

96 Join Devi and the gang for some laughs Credit: Netflix

Devi is a regular 16 year old girl who's trying to live her life but a few obstacles hold her back.

After her father passes away and she becomes paralysed from the waist down she thinks her life is over.

Her Indian immigrant mum who treads the line between modern and traditional is trying her best to raise her with the same values she was raised with.

Throw in an unreadable crush, an arch nemesis and fracturing friendships and you have a relatable sitcom.

Produced by Mindy Kaling.

Season 2 is currently in production and is expected to drop later in 2021.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 97%.

8. Glee

96 Lea Michele belts out the show tunes on Glee Credit: Netflix

Everyone’s favourite music is sung by some of the best young voices.

The glee club is made up of the outcasts of the school and the school reminds them of this very thing.

With jocks, cheerleaders and nerds, these misfits use music in order to unite them.

However, a meddling cheerleader coach and noncompliant principle threaten their success in more ways than one.

The show has become as well known for its incredible soundtrack as its episodic drama.

Starring Lea Michele and Matthew Morrison.

Glee came to an end with season 6 back in 2015.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 71%.

9. New Girl

96 Jess and the gang bring chaos to any situation Credit: Netflix

Jess (Zooey Deschanel) moves in with three roommates who have a familial yet chaotic bond.

After moving in and facing many of life's obstacles the foursome establish a balance with each other.

Jess’s fun, quirky and bubbly personality clashes with her roommate's pessimistic, overbearing personalities.

Facing the trials and tribulations of love, jobs and their relationships with one another in a humorous way.

There are five seasons of New Girl available to stream now.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 82%

10. Modern Family

96 Follow this not so typical family Credit: Netflix

This family shows all the good and difficult parts of having a large modern family.

The story follows three different types of families. The nuclear family, step family and a same sex couple.

All living in the Los Angeles area facing different problems with their children and within their relationships in the most fun way possible.

Family comedy drama with Sarah Hyland, Sofia Vergara, Jesse Tyler Ferguson and more.

Modern Family came to an end with an emotional series finale last year.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 88%

11. The Good Place

96 Delve into the afterlife where The Good Place isn't all it seems Credit: Netflix

This show is perfect for people who want a visual representation of what may happen when you die.

Or it could be an indication of what not to do if you want to go to the bad place (Hell).

Eleanor Shellstrop (Kristen Bell) is an ordinary woman who enters the afterlife, but an error sends her to The Good Place instead of The Bad Place.

Figuring out why she’s there and trying to hide the fact she shouldn’t be gets harder and harder as she hides from Good Place architect Micheal (Ted Danson).

Suffice to say the afterlife has never been so chaotic...

The Good Place came to an end with season 4 last year.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 89%

12. Dead to Me

96 An unconventional friendship but will a secret break them apart? Credit: Netflix

Jen (Christina Applegate) is recently widowed after her husband is killed in a hit and run accident.

Determined to investigate after the incident, Judy (Linda Cardellini) appears as her friend after meeting in a support group.

Judy is facing her own loss however, the pair bond despite their clash of personalities.

However, Judy is hiding a secret that threatens to destroy Jen’s life.

There are two seasons of Dead to Me out now, with a third and final season expected to arrive later this year.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 92%

13. After Life

96 Ricky Gervais plays a widower called Tony in this hit Netflix series Credit: Free for editorial use

Ricky Gervais' acclaimed series sees him play Tony, a widower trying to come to terms with the loss of his wife.

While the series has you in tears at times as Ricky delves into the subject matter of death and grief, it also has plenty of laughs.

The C-bomb is dropped a lot across the two series so be warned, but its no surprise this has been lauded as one of Ricky's finest pieces of work to date.

There are two seasons of Afterlife available to stream now, with a third on the way later this year.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 74%

14. Big Mouth

96 The characters on Big Mouth are challenged with issues like dating, sexuality, and porn addiction Credit: Netflix

Big Mouth is an animated show on Netflix created by Nick Kroll, Andrew Goldberg, Mark Levin, and Jennifer Flackett.

It follows characters Jessi, Andrew, and Nick as they navigate their way through their awkward pubescent years.

The three best friends and their schoolmates are challenged with issues like dating, sexuality, and porn addiction.

Deadline has reported that season four of the show "focuses on anxiety, but not the political kind".

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 76%

15. Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt

96 Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt already has four seasons on Netflix Credit: Netflix

This hilarious series is the perfect pick me up for when you’re feeling a bit meh. And thanks to the short but sweet episodes, it’s the perfect thing to switch on when you get home from work and just want some light-hearted television.

There’s already four seasons available on Netflix and we guarantee you’ll get hooked as you follow Kimmy (played by Ellie Kemper) as she as she adjusts to life after her rescue from a doomsday cult, where she and three other women were held by Reverend Richard Wayne Gary Wayne (Jon Hamm) for 15 years.

Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt came to an end with season 4 in 2019.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 95%

Sci-Fi & Fantasy

16. Stranger Things

96 Will they find solve the mystery of the missing boy? Credit: Netflix

Acclaimed series Stranger Things is seen as a love letter to 80’s sci-fi. Set in 1983, Indiana, a young boy vanishes into thin air under seriously dark circumstances.

Family, friends and the local police begin searching for answers, however they stumble upon a mysterious young girl in a top-secret government facility.

Starring Millie Bobby Brown, the series is suitable for tweens upwards and fuses horror elements with classic coming-of-age relationships.

The show now has three full series under its belt, with a fourth expected to drop in 2021.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 91%

17. The Umbrella Academy

96 Seven youngsters born in supernatural circumstances come back together to help save the world in Marvels new series Credit: Netflix

Based on the comic book series of the same name, The Umbrella Academy tracks forty-three infants who are born to an array of women who showed no symptoms of pregnancy until the day before they were due to give birth.

Seven of them are adopted by a billionaire industrialist, Reginald Hargreeves, who creates The Umbrella Academy.

He uses the children in his plans to save the world, but only ends up leaving the family fractured. The family disband and only reunite upon Hargreaves passing away, discovering his darkest secrets.

Expect time travel, large-scale battles and witty one-liners aplenty.

Starring Robert Sheehan and Elliot Page.

The Umbrella Academy's third season is expected to drop later in 2021.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 86%

18. Daredevil

96 Charlie Cox takes on the role of Matt Murdock in Marvel series Daredevil Credit: Netflix

Even if you’re not a massive Marvel fan, we can guarantee you’ll binge-watch all three seasons of Daredevil.

Based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name, the show stars Charlie Cox as Matt Murdock AKA Daredevil, a blind lawyer-by-day who fights crime as a masked vigilante by night.

The show is decidedly gritter than many in the superhero genre and has something to offer outside of the typical sci-fi / comic book audience.

A spin-off series, centered on Bernthal's character Frank Castle/ Punisher and titled The Punisher, was ordered by Netflix in April 2016 but sadly Daredevil was cancelled in November 2018.

However, Disney+ has since acquired the rights to the franchise, so the show could make a return in 2021 or beyond.

Fans have even launched a campaign to resurrect the show.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 92%

19. Snowpiercer

96 Snowpiercer stars stars Jennifer Connelly and Daveed Diggs and is an adaptation of a book and film Credit: TM & © Turner Entertainment Networks, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved

Snowpiercer is a post-apocalyptic dystopian thriller series based on both the 2013 South Korean-Czech film of the same name and the 1982 French graphic novel Le Transperceneige, from which the film was adapted.

The show consists of ten episodes and stars Jennifer Connelly, Daveed Diggs and Sean Bean.

The plot follows the passengers of the Snowpiercer, a gigantic, perpetually moving train that circles the globe carrying the remnants of humanity seven years after the world becomes a frozen wasteland.

The series questions class warfare, social injustice, and the politics of survival.

Season 2 kicks off in January 2021, with season 3 set to follow next year.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 94%

20. The Witcher

96 The Witcher dropped on Netflix at the end of 2019 Credit: Netflix

Fantasy fans looking to fill the void of Game of Thrones can be sure to love this one.

A mutated monster hunter struggles to find his place in the world where it becomes increasingly difficult to decipher who is more wicked: human beings or beasts?

Expect gory battle sequences against all menner of mystical creatures and magic aplenty.

Starring Henry Cavill as the hunky Geralt of Rivia, The Witcher brings plenty of eye candy too.

Season 2 is expected to hit Netflix late in 2021.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 92%

21. Teen Wolf

96 How will these teens survive high school and being werewolves? Credit: Netflix

In the remake of the Michael J. Fox cult classic, Tyler Posey plays a teen who becomes a werewolf.

Far from the romantic cliche’s in Twilight, Teen Wolf is funny and action-filled.

With 6 seasons, and many mystical creatures who are easy on the eyes, this is the perfect series to binge watch.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 81%

22. Black Mirror

96 Dystopian series Black Mirror takes a chilling look at how technology can change our lives Credit: �Netflix 2017

Charlie Brooker has managed to create a truly chilling and dystopian vision of how technology can change our lives in Black Mirror.

Each season focuses on different yet equally disturbing subjects, with A-list guest stars including Miley Cyrus, Mad Men's Jon Hamm, Black Panther's Letitia Wright, Bryce Dallas-Howard and Andrew Scott.

The series also includes the mindblowing one-off Bandersnatch, where viewers choose their own adventure.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 83%

Drama

23. The Stranger

96 Follow one man's quest to find out information about a family he doesn't know Credit: Netflix

If your fill of drama comes from mystery thrillers then look no further.

This gripping whodunit follows a stranger who makes some shocking claims about members of a small town, throwing local families into chaos.

One family man becomes entangled in a mystery of deadly proportions whilst searching for answers about his wife's pregnancy.

The Stranger is guaranteed to keep viewers on the edge of their seats with its many twists and turns.

Despite rave reviews, there are currently no plans for a second season of The Stranger.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 76%

24. When They See Us

96 When They See Us is a four-part series based on real life events Credit: AP:Associated Press

This four-part series starring Asante Blackk and Jharrel Jerome is based on the events of the April 19, 1989, Central Park jogger case and explores the lives of the five suspects who were falsely prosecuted on charges related to the sexual assault of a female victim, and of their families.

In June 2019, Netflix announced that the miniseries had been streamed by over 23 million viewers within its first month of release and the show went on to win several awards, so it really is a must see.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 96%

25. Gossip Girl

96 The Upper East siders are having a hard time whilst Gossip Girl is around, but who is she? Credit: Seventeen Magazine

If you’ve always wanted an insight on the lives of rich kids in New York, then this is the perfect escapism for you.

These privileged teenagers create chaos on the Upper East Side while a blogger named after the show's title writes about them, airing their dirty laundry.

The identity of the mysterious blogger, aka Gossip Girl, isn’t revealed until the end and it’s a surprising twist to say the least. Starring You’s Penn Badgley and Blake Lively.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 77%

26. Sex Education

96 Follow the teens who open an underground sex therapy clinic Credit: Netflix

Filled with laughs and socially awkward teens, this coming-of-age drama offers something different.

Following the life of Otis Milburn (Asa Butterfield) and his sex therapist mum (Gillian Anderson), expect cringes and giggles in equal measure. Due to his mother's teachings, plus the endless manuals and books he’s been exposed to, he uses his specialist knowledge to elevate his social status in school.

Together with his friends, they set up an underground sex therapy clinic to help fellow students deal with their problems and ordeals.

There are two full series of Sex Education out now, with a third expected to drop in 2021.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 94%

27. Gilmore Girls

96 The Gilmore Girls journey includes romance and drama Credit: Netflix

Mother and daughter duo Loralai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) and Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) show the humorous and heartfelt journey of friendship and family in this beloved classic.

It takes a cross-generational view of things, with single mother Lorelai's difficult relationship with her own parents also under the microscope, as well as Rory's journey through high school and university.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 86%

28. The Crown

96 Matt Smith played Prince Philip in some risky scenes in The Crown Credit: Netflix

Looking at the British monarchy and the government, The Crown follows the two famous addresses - Buckingham Palace and 10 Downing Street.

The scandals, their love lives and the events that shaped the second half of the 20th century make up the historic drama. Two houses, one court, one crown.

There are four full seasons of The Crown available to stream now, with a fifth in the works.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 90%

29. Top Boy

96 Top Boy follows two British lads who sell drugs in order to get rich quick Credit: Netflix

Modern day gang members who are looking to get rich quick selling drugs rarely come without their own baggage and Top Boy is no different.

Far from the likes of Power, Top Boy offers insight into the British gang scene and the trials and tribulations of these young men.

Ashley Walters gives a compelling performance as Dushane, so fans of Bulletproof should definitely give this thriller a chance.

Production on Netflix's second season kicked off last year, with a release expected in later 2021.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 94%

30. Mindhunter

96 The Netflix drama follows two detectives who interview serial killers to solve cold cases Credit: Netflix

With the 1970’s as the backdrop, this story follows two FBI agents who are tasked with interviewing serial killers in order to solve older open cases.

CSI enthusiasts will find the series absorbing, chilling and utterly addictive.

Probably not for you if you're on the squeamish side though...

Mindhunter was put on hold after two seasons, with rumours of a third still hotly contested.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 95%

31. Pose

96 Inspiring and informative Credit: Netflix

Set in the 1980’s during the AIDS epidemic, Pose is based on Blanca Rodriguez (MJ Rodriguez) after she is diagnosed with HIV.

Following her positive diagnosis, she breaks Elektra (Dominique Jackson), the mother of the House of Abundance and starts her own ‘’house’’.

The house takes in LGBTQ+ youth who have been rejected or thrown out by their biological families .

The new family consists of youngsters with dreams who need a safe haven.

Be careful though, this series tugs at the heartstrings.

There are two seasons of Pose out now, with a third currently in production.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 96%

32. Suits

96 Top Manhattan lawyers fight it out in court Credit: Netflix

Meghan Markle, Patrick Adams, Gina Torres and Gabriel Macht star as some of Manhattan's top corporate lawyers.

Macht plays Harvey Spectre, a brilliant lawyer who need to hire an associate.

Patrick Adams stars as college dropout Mike Ross, who's looking for his next gig but accidentally stumbles across a new opportunity.

Filled with scandal, lies, corruption, romance and more.

Suits came to an end with its ninth season back in 2019.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 86%

33. Ozark

96 Will this family be able to deal with the dirty money? Credit: Netflix

A family moves into an Ozarks resort community and faces struggles due to the new place filled with dirty money.

Jason Bateman plays a financial adviser who must appease a drug boss by laundering money, with his wife Wendy (Laura Linney) being dragged into the criminal dealing too.

The series aired its third season, complete with jaw-dropping finale, last year - and has been nominated for a slew of awards.

It will conclude with season 4 later this year.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 91%

34. Better Call Saul

96 The prequel to Breaking Bad Credit: Netflix

The prequel to Breaking Bad, Better Call Saul is set in the 2000's, and follows the story of con-man turned lawyer Jimmy McGill (Bob Odenkirk).

It begins six years before Breaking Bad and shows the transformation of the criminal for hire.

McGill uses his skills to enter the criminal underworld of drug trafficking, and meets a whole host of shady characters along the way.

With five seasons out now, there's plenty to sink your teeth into.

Rotten Tomatoes audience rating: 96%

35. How To Get Away With Murder

96 Follow the whodunnit style TV drama Credit: Netflix

A law professor picks a group of her best students to assist her with some high profile cases.

However, all is not as it seems when Annalise Keating (Viola Davis) reveals that she has more than one skeleton in her closet.

Secrets, lies and death await the eager college students who got more than they bargained for.

Also starring Alfred Enoch, Connor Walsh, Aja Naomi King and Matt McGorry.

There are six seasons of How To Get Away With Murder available now.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 86%

36. Dare Me

91. Challenger: The Final Flight

96 This documentary looks at the 1986 Challenger space tragedy Credit: Netflix

This four-part documentary series tells the true story of the 1986 Challenger space disaster, which saw the space shuttle break up 73 second after launch, killing all seven crew members.

As well as looking at the mechanical failures that caused the tragedy, the crew's family talk about their loved ones and how they became one of the most diverse space crews ever created.

The documentary makers also speak to former Nasa engineers and officials who worked on the mission, many of which had raised safety concerns before the launch.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 92%

92. Ash vs Evil Dead

96 Bruce Campbell is back in Ash vs Evil Dead Credit: Starz/Netflix

Fans of the cult horror Evil Dead franchise will love seeing Bruce Campbell back on their screens as the titular Ash.

Just like the films, the series is tongue-in-cheek and sees Ash team up with two department store colleagues to fight a whole host of ghouls.

There are three season to enjoy and while a fourth is looking unlikely, the episodes are worth a watch fo any die hard fans of Sam Raimi's original trilogy.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 94%

93. Cobra Kai

96 Cobra Kai follows on from the Karate Kid films

Originally a breakout hit on YouTube, Cobra Kai moved to Netflix and has been commissioned for a fourth season before the third has even aired.

The series is another blast of nostalgia as it follows on from the Karate Kid film series and sees Johnny Lawrence (William Zabka) open his own dojo.

His rivalry with Daniel LaRusso (Ralph Macchio) is reignited for another epic martial arts showdown.

Cobra Kai's fourth season is expected to arrive later this year.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 93%

94. GLOW

96 GLOW follows a group of female wrestlers Credit: NETFLIX

GLOW tells the story of the Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling, a real-life group formed to promote women’s wrestling on TV, however the actual characters are fake.

Alison Brie leads the cast as Ruth, who auditions for a wrestling group as she struggles to make ends meet as an actress.

However, she gets a shock when her former BFF Debbie is already part of the group, with tensions high between the two thanks to Ruth stealing Debbie's husband.

With plenty of drama, colourful leotards and a killer 80s soundtrack, GLOW has delighted fans for three seasons until it was unceremoniously axed by Netflix despite originally commissioning a fourth.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 86%

95. Schitt's Creek

96 Schitt's Creek has won a slew of Emmys Credit: AP:Associated Press

If you need a laugh, look no further than Schitt's Creek, a Canadian sitcom which has won a slew of Emmy Awards.

The series follows the Rose family, who used to be wealthy and privileged but are now trying to rebuild their life in the titular town.

Parents Johnny and Moira - along with their adult children David and Alexis - are forced to live in adjoining motel rooms, not ideal considering their spoilt nature but perfect for comedy.

We also have to give a shout out to Catherine O'Hara and her stunning array of wigs as Moira.

Finished the show? Netflix has also released a documentary about the production and rise of the sitcom.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 94%

96. The Queen's Gambit

96 The Queen's Gambit has taken Netflix by storm Credit: Splash News

This limited series follows orphan and chess prodigy Beth Harmon in the 1950s and 60s.

Anna Taylor-Joy plays the troubled lead, and while chess doesn't sound exciting enough to base a drama around, it is utterly compelling, not to mention stylish.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 95%

97. Blood of Zeus

An adult animation using the best of anime to tell this ancient Greek story, Blood of Zeus comes from the same studios as Castlevania.

A commoner living in ancient Greece, Heron discovers his true heritage as a son of Zeus, and his purpose: to save the world from a demonic army.

With Mount Olympus divided into two factions, deities clash in battles of Earth-shattering proportions.

Note - this isn't for you if you're squeamish as there's plenty of violence.

Blood of Zeus will return for a second series later this year.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 100%

98. Fauda

Fauda tells the human stories on both sides of the Israel-Palestine conflict.

This Israeli series draws on their experiences of its creators in the Israel Defense Forces.

It tells the story of Doron, a commander in the Mista'arvim unit and his team as they pursue a Hamas arch-terrorist known as "The Panther."

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 100%

99. Sense8

Sense8 hooks you in with its sexy clusters

The American science fiction drama created by Lana and Lilly Wachowski has such a strong cult following that when it was cancel, its fans fervently petitioned Netflix to bring it back.

Sense8 is about a group of people around the world are suddenly linked mentally, and must find a way to survive being hunted by those who see them as a threat to the world's order.

It explores issues related to identity, sexuality, gender, and politics that Lana and Lilly had never seen on TV.

Alas, Sens8 was cancelled after its second season back in 2018.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 86%

100. Kingdom

South Korean pop culture is on a global roll right now, from BTS to the Oscar winning Parasite, so it's no wonder Netflix rushed to make its own series there.

Kingdom is a zombie thriller where a Korean prince is sent out on a mission to investigate an outbreak that threatens his kingdom.

While it's also a supernatural thriller, Kingdom serves period drama realness, explorations of class and privilege.

Rotten Tomatoes Audience Rating: 96%
summary:
Based on the immaculate conception Bible story, the series follows Jane Villenuva, who is a virgin that is artificially inseminated.
Modern Family96 Follow this not so typical family Credit: NetflixThis family shows all the good and difficult parts of having a large modern family.
After Life96 Ricky Gervais plays a widower called Tony in this hit Netflix series Credit: Free for editorial useRicky Gervais' acclaimed series sees him play Tony, a widower trying to come to terms with the loss of his wife.
The South African three-part series follows the tale of two families who are about to get joined together through an extravagant wedding.
Last Chance U96 This is one of the most successful docuseries on Netflix Credit: ©2020 Netflix, Inc.

title: Two 15-year-old girls ‘drugged and gang-raped in Australian park by 10 men who groomed them on Snapchat’
text:
FOUR men have been charged after two teenage girls were allegedly drugged and gang-raped in a park by 10 men who groomed the victims on Snapchat.

The men have been charged with 160 offences in total after the sickening alleged attack on two 15-year-old girls in a park in Brisbane, cops said.

4 Four men have been charged with 160 offences in total after the alleged attack Credit: Google Earth

4 Police said the girls met one of the men on Snapchat before meeting up with the group in the park Credit: 9news

The four men are each facing 40 offences, including 16 counts of rape, according to reports.

Cops claim up to 10 men drugged and repeatedly raped the girls in Calamvale District Park, south of Brisbane, before threatening them with a broken bottle, 9News reports.

Police said the girls met one of the men on Snapchat before meeting up with the group in the park on December 28.

Queensland Police confirmed the four men - who cannot be named for legal reasons - were charged on Saturday.

"Police have charged four men following ongoing investigations into the alleged rape of two teenage girls in Calamvale last year," the force said on Twitter.

A 19-year-old man, a 20-year-old man, a 22-year-old man, and a 21-year-old man have been charged, according to reports.

The charges include rape, assault with intent to commit rape, and indecent treatment of a child - two of which allege indecent photographs were taken, ABC reports.

Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll said investigations are ongoing and more men are expected to be charged in the coming days over the alleged incident.

4 Queensland Police confirmed the four men were charged on Saturday Credit: Aussie Dad Bloke / Wikimedia commons

4 Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll said more men are expected to be charged in the coming days Credit: ABC

The 19-year-old was refused bail after appearing at Brisbane Magistrates Court today.

"They were aware of their age," police prosecutor Senior Constable Min Hu told the court, 9News reports.

"They seduced them with alcohol and drugs and raped them."

"The victims told the offenders to stop several times," Mr Hue also told the court, according to ABC.

"The victim said to him, 'You don't have to do this'."

The prosecutor claimed each rape occurred for "10 to 15 minutes" and described the alleged offences as "extreme" and "serious".

He also claims the 19-year-old told one of the girls: "Sorry if we hurt you."

The 19-year-old's lawyer Bianca Van Heerden said he does not deny knowing the two girls but said "he strongly denies any involvement".

"He will strongly contest the charges," she said.

Speaking to reporters, Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll said: "This is an absolutely sickening, sickening incident. And something those young girls will have to live with for the rest of their lives."

"I expect that more perpetrators will be held to account as a result of that offence," she added.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home DEAL OR NO DEAL? Nazanin's husband has 'heard nothing' after Iran's claim she'll be freed KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash

"All I can say, it was just horrific, to think what has occurred with two young girls, with a number of men, an extraordinary amount of offences, there will be more people charged I am confident over the next few days."

The 22-year-old man and the 21-year-old man had their cases briefly mentioned in Richlands Magistrates Court on Monday, ABC reports.

The fourth co-accused - the 20-year-old man - was remanded in custody on Saturday to appear in court later this month.
summary:
FOUR men have been charged after two teenage girls were allegedly drugged and gang-raped in a park by 10 men who groomed the victims on Snapchat.
The men have been charged with 160 offences in total after the sickening alleged attack on two 15-year-old girls in a park in Brisbane, cops said.
Police said the girls met one of the men on Snapchat before meeting up with the group in the park on December 28.
"Police have charged four men following ongoing investigations into the alleged rape of two teenage girls in Calamvale last year," the force said on Twitter.
The prosecutor claimed each rape occurred for "10 to 15 minutes" and described the alleged offences as "extreme" and "serious".

title: Larry Flynt death: The wild life of a porn mogul who loved naked hostesses and was left paralysed by white supremacist
text:
A NOTORIOUS pornographer who courted controversy and sought to “offend everyone on an equal-opportunity basis”, Larry Flynt was a man with many enemies.

But having survived an assassination attempt which saw him hit by bullets in his stomach and spine in 1978 – as well as numerous legal challenges which sought to censor his smut – Flynt died naturally of heart failure on Wednesday aged 78.

13 Larry Flynt, the owner of $100m porn empire, has died aged 78 Credit: Pacific Coast News

The cigar-chomping, bling-loving American, who was played by Woody Harrelson in 1996 movie The People vs. Larry Flynt, built a $100million porn empire that stretched from magazines to private clubs, a Los Angeles casino, an online sex-toy store and more.

He was best known for his magazine Hustler which repeatedly tested the boundaries of free speech with its extremely explicit sexual content.

It infamously published everything from topless pictures of former First Lady Jackie Kennedy Onassis to images depicting gang rape.

Flynt spent much of his life defending himself against charges of obscenity in and out of court – and it was near a courthouse that he was shot by a white supremacist serial killer who took exception to an interracial porn shoot printed in Hustler.

After being shot, Flynt was paralysed from the waist down and used a $17,000 gold plated and velvet-upholstered wheelchair.

13 He used a lavish gold-plated wheelchair after being paralysed by a white supremacist sniper in the 70s Credit: Getty Images - Getty

A self-styled defender of America’s First Amendment – which promises freedom of speech and press – he delighted in causing controversy.

His magazine offended an incredible range of groups from left-wing feminists to anti-porn conservatives and just about everyone in between.

“I wanted to offend everyone on an equal-opportunity basis,” he wrote in his 1996 autobiography, An Unseemly Man.

“I decided to run cartoons lampooning blacks, whites, Jews, Christians, rich and poor.”

Naked waitresses and extreme porn

From an early age, Flynt showed the world he had no desire to live conventionally.

Born to an alcoholic father and a teenage mother in a poverty-stricken part of Kentucky, he dropped out of school at 15 and used a fake birth certificate to join the Army.

13 Flynt created the Hustler brand of strip clubs which proved a huge hit Credit: BackGrid

When they kicked him out after seven months, he lied again and joined the Navy as a radio operator for five years.

After that, in 1965 he spent $1,800 of his savings to buy his mother’s bar in Dayton, Ohio which would be the beginning of his business empire.

Flynt brought in naked hostesses to serve drinks and would work 20-hour days, taking amphetamines to stay awake.

His business was soon making $1,000 a week and he used the cash to buy other bars.

13 He made a fortune from his bars and was able to create an adult entertainment business empire Credit: AP:Associated Press

By the early 1970s, he had the template for his Hustler adult clubs. Then he struck upon the idea of transforming the club’s basic newsletter into a full-blown porn magazine.

From its first issue in 1974, Hustler magazine was designed to shock.

Flynn calculated that men wanted “raw sex” – not the stylised version presented by glossier rivals.

He said: “Playboy and Penthouse were parading their pornography as art, with the airbrushing and the soft lens. I realised that if we became more explicit, we could get a huge piece of this market.”

13 Hustler had a readership of three million at the height of its popularity Credit: BackGrid

With this in mind, nothing was off the table for Hustler - from close up shots of female genitalia to depictions of gang rape, fairytale characters engaging in sexual acts, and one cover which showed a woman being fed head-first into a meat grinder.

One regular cartoon character, Chester the Molester, was shown tricking pre-pubscent girls into sexually compromising situations.

And in 1975, Hustler created a global scandal when it printed paparazzi photographs of former First Lady Jackie Kennedy Onassis sunbathing topless while on holiday - paying $18,000 for the shots after rivals Playboy and Penthouse rejected the pictures.

As Hustler raced to become ever more hardcore, many people were appalled.

13 Flynt taking the oath during one of his many legal trials

But Flynt revelled in defending his work, framing it as a battle for free speech.

“My position has always been that there’s two types of people opposed to pornography,” he once said during a TV interview, “Those who don’t know what they’re talking about, and those who don’t know what they’re missing.”

At the height of its popularity, Hustler had a readership of three million, allowing Flynt to get into other business ventures including porn movies and mainstream magazines.

But his dirty empire kept him in constant legal trouble, with his first of several prosecutions for obscenity in 1976.

13 Hustler was the crowning jewel in Flynt's vast porn empire Credit: AFP or licensors

During another trial, he wore an American flag as a nappy, which caused him to be jailed for six months for desecrating the flag.

His most high profile court battle came in 1983 when televangelist Jerry Falwell sued Flynt for $45million.

Falwell argued he should be financially compensated for the “ridicule and emotional distress” caused by a satirical cartoon published in Hustler, which showed him boasting of losing his virginity to his mother in an outhouse.

13 Flynt with the satirical advert that landed him in the Supreme Court

The case went all the way to the Supreme Court who ruled unanimously in Flynt’s favour, saying that offensive speech aimed at public figures like Falwell was constitutionally protected as long as it wasn’t presented as factual.

After the trial, the porn mogul and the preacher who sued him became unlikely friends.

Gunned down by white supremacist murderer

A more dramatic court showdown was to come. While defending himself against more obscenity charges, Flynt and his lawyer, Gene Reeves Jr., were gunned down outside a courthouse near Atlanta, Georgia, in 1978.

Flynt was paralysed by the attack and left suffering excruciating pain in his legs and related health problems for the rest of his life.

Joseph Paul Franklin, a KKK member and serial killer, later confessed to the shooting, saying he was motivated by interracial pornography in Hustler.

13 Flynt being taken to hospital after he was shot in the stomach and spine in 1978

13 Joseph Paul Franklin later confessed to the shooting as part of his crime spree Credit: AP:Associated Press

Franklin was executed by lethal injection 2013 – something which Flynt publicly opposed.

He didn’t want Franklin dead, but he did want revenge.

“I would love an hour in a room with him and a pair of wire-cutters and pliers so I could inflict the same damage on him that he inflicted on me,” he wrote in the Hollywood Reporter.

'You have to tolerate Larry Flynt'

Flynt’s opposition to the execution of his attacker wasn’t the only belief he held which shocked people.

In 1977, he briefly declared himself a born-again Christian after having a divine vision while on his private jet, vowing his magazine would “hustle for God”.

13 Courtney Love, Woody Harrelson, and Ed Norton in the film The People Vs Larry Flynt (1996) Credit: Columbia Pictures

For a brief spell – during which he was friends with evangelist Ruth Carter Stapleton, sister of President Jimmy Carter – Flynt toned down Hustler’s content.

But before long he had declared himself an atheist once more – and Hustler went back to its old ways.

Having dabbled with religion, Flynt also tried his hand at politics, making a “tongue-in-cheek” run for president in 1984 as a Republican.

Fourteen years later, he declared he was a Democrat – predictably supporting Bill Clinton in the impeachment proceedings which followed the Monica Lewinsky affair.

13 Flynt was famously promiscuous and was married five times Credit: Barry Sweet/ Polaris

Flynt has four surviving children from five marriages – having racked up three divorces by the time he was 33.

His oldest daughter, Tonya Flynt-Vega, is a Christian anti-porn activist who published a book, Hustled, in 1998 accusing Flynt of sexually abusing her as a child.

Flynt denied the claims.

His fourth wife, Althea, was pictured in Hustler and went on to become the magazine’s co-publisher, keeping it running when Flynt was shot.

13 Flynt always defended his work in terms of freedom of expression Credit: AFP or licensors

She was just 17 when she met Flynt by applying to be a go-go dancer at one of his clubs.

They married in 1976 and stayed together until her death 11 years later when she drowned in the bath of their Bel-Air mansion, aged 33.

In 1998, Flynt married his fifth wife, Elizabeth Berrios, his former nurse.

That marriage came two years after the release of the Oscar-nominated film about his life and legal troubles, The People Vs Larry Flynt.

The film was criticised by some for sanitising Flynt’s career and views.

MORE IN NEWS Exclusive TWILIGHT KILLER My twisted sister had sex with her boyfriend after he murdered our family Investigation SOLD FOR SEX Inside Romanian sex trafficking ring where girls are brought to UK to be raped Sexflix Best & worst TV sex scenes - from Normal People's 'real' sex to Bridgerton romps HOUSE OF HORRORS Tragic tale of disabled victims kidnapped, pimped out & fed cockroaches Exclusive 'MATE CRIME' My disabled son was murdered by ‘friend’ who pushed his body around in a pram PROUD PA How Philip made sure his daughters-in-law always felt accepted into the family

But according to the man himself, the nastier side of him was the cost of preserving free speech.

He said: “My position is that you pay a price to live in a free society, and that price is toleration of some things you don’t like,” he told the Seattle Times in 1996.

“You have to tolerate the Larry Flynts of this world.”
summary:
A NOTORIOUS pornographer who courted controversy and sought to “offend everyone on an equal-opportunity basis”, Larry Flynt was a man with many enemies.
He was best known for his magazine Hustler which repeatedly tested the boundaries of free speech with its extremely explicit sexual content.
Then he struck upon the idea of transforming the club’s basic newsletter into a full-blown porn magazine.
From its first issue in 1974, Hustler magazine was designed to shock.
That marriage came two years after the release of the Oscar-nominated film about his life and legal troubles, The People Vs Larry Flynt.
