title: How brutal foreign gangs have carved up London fuelled by cocaine epidemic
text:
TWO shameless Chilean gangsters pose in gold necklaces after jetting into Britain and ransacking celebrity chef Marcus Wareing's £5 million London home.

Their brazenness is shocking - yet it's only the latest in a string of horrific crimes, including assassinations and stabbings, linked to foreign gangsters who have infiltrated the UK capital.

36 Chilean 'burglary tourists' Danko Carvajal-Donaire and Nicolas Portilla-Astorga pose in stolen jewellery after raiding TV chef Marcus Wareing's home Credit: PA:Press Association

36 Celebrity chef Marcus and his wife Jane, who were left devastated by the £33,000 raid Credit: Getty Images - Getty

London has become a hotbed of international criminals - from Albanian cocaine kingpins and African street gangsters to Turkish Cypriots known for robberies and contract killings.

On one residential street in Walthamstow - home to the notorious Somali 'Mali Boys' gang - families have been left so terrified by bloody gang warfare they refuse to go out at night.

36

Stabbed, beaten and impaled on railings

Elsewhere in the capital, people have been beaten to death, knifed in the street, found impaled on railings and had their homes raided, in incidents all linked to international gangs.

While many of the victims are foreign gangsters themselves, others are unsuspecting members of the public and even celebrities - like Marcus, who was left devastated by the raid on his home.

And experts tell Sun Online the situation in London is only escalating - as the UK's £11 billion drugs trade and other illicit markets have become more powerful and international in recent years.

"We’ve observed a rise of internationally-affiliated gangs controlling illegal trade and organised criminal activity in areas of London and across county borders surrounding London and further afield," says top London-based defence solicitor Nick Titchener.

36 The London-based Albanian gang 'Hellbanianz' have boasted about their lawless lifestyle in Instagram snaps Credit: Refer to Caption

"These criminal networks can span continents and will engage in activities such as drug, firearm and people trafficking, fraud offences and prostitution, with the proceeds of criminal activity then being laundered in a variety of ways to disguise the profit that is being generated."



Gangs fighting for turf

He adds: "London has become a hotbed for the gang-controlled drug markets.

"Unfortunately, with the drugs and sex trade there is often an associated increase in violent crimes, serious assault charges, and murder offences as control of an area is fought for."

In London, up to a third of all suspects are reported to be from abroad.

But former undercover cop Neil Woods tells us that every time tireless London officers bring down organised criminals, they open up opportunities for more efficient gangsters to swoop in.

"What police do is they get rid of the competition," he says.

"It's like any marketplace - the more efficient ones grow and become bigger monopolies. The people in control of drug supplies now are in charge of big international businesses...

"You'll have much more of this as time goes on, it's inevitable."

36 Albert Memia, nickname Diti, was jailed in the UK for his part in an Albanian-Kosovan cocaine gang Credit: Scottish Crime and Drug Enforcement Agency

36 Former undercover cop Neil Woods, pictured, warns that the situation will only escalate Credit: News Group Newspapers Ltd

The National Crime Agency (NCA) reckons there are at least 4,600 organised crime groups (OCGs) operating across the UK today, with London now dubbed the world's money-laundering capital.

Of course, many of these are brutal home-grown British gangs.

But recently, the rise of people and drug-smuggling, the Internet, and Brits' seemingly insatiable appetite for cocaine has seen an influx of foreign gangsters descend on the country.

Others - often those at the top - are running operations in London from luxury pads overseas.

Here, we reveal some of the ruthless international criminals infiltrating the capital...

The Albanian cocaine kingpins

Turf: East London

Albanian mobsters have become the "dominant" global players in Britain's drugs trade, Neil says, having pulled off a near-total takeover of our £5 billion cocaine industry.

The NCA warns these ruthless gangsters - who use London as their main hub - pose a "significant threat" and are quick to use "violence, particularly around enforcing the drug trade".

Sources say the Albanians have teamed up with the ’Ndrangheta, the most powerful Italian Mafia franchise, to ship huge hauls of cocaine to the UK from European sea ports.

36 Albanian gangsters aren't afraid to show off their illicit cash on social media Credit: Refer to Caption

36 The Albanians are said to be the "dominant" global players in Britain's drugs trade Credit: Instagram

Once inside the country, the drug is pushed by street dealers and enforcers such as the brazen Hellbanianz, who have been blamed for rising gang violence in East London.

Based in Barking, the street gang has previously posted rap videos and pictures of flash cars, guns and wads of cash on social media, encouraging other Albanian foot-soldiers to join them.

Solicitor Nick, of Lawtons Law, tells us: "There’s no doubt that social media can promote the recruitment of young people, attracted by images of piles of cash, expensive watches, and a lifestyle that might seem to be out of reach.

"These are the people that often lose out as they are on the front line, putting themselves at risk from gang violence, becoming addicted themselves or ending up in court facing prosecution and a criminal conviction."

36 Three men pose in a prison cell beside the Hellbanianz gang's logo Credit: Instagram

36 A now-deleted Hellbanianz Instagram page boasts that the gang's motto is 'We Are God Of The Streets' Credit: Refer to Caption

36 The group have previously uploaded pictures of flash motors and drugs cash Credit: Instagram

In one set of shocking rap lyrics, Hellbanianz gangsters boasted: “We gun you down cos Albanians need no reason. They try to catch us, but these Albanians can’t be caught."

Despite their claims, three of the gang were locked up for a total of 42 years in 2016 after police discovered £6 million of drugs and a Skorpion sub-machine gun with a silencer.

Dozens of other Albanian criminals have also been arrested and jailed across Britain in recent years - with figures showing they now make up one in ten foreign prisoners.

Known as the Mafia Shqiptare, gangsters from Albania are governed by the deadly 'kanun' code: the right to take revenge, according to the Mail on Sunday.

They reportedly carry out assassinations in the UK for £15,000 to £100,000 a hit. They have also been accused of running brothels and torturing underworld enemies.

36 Drug-dealing model Olsi Beheluli, seen posing with mounds of cash, was jailed in 2015 after more than £4million of cocaine and heroin was seized from his London-based Albanian gang Credit: SWNS:South West News Service

36 A picture from the Hellbanianz Instagram page, which has apparently been shut down Credit: Instagram

36 Albanian Luan Plakici made £1 million from sex trafficking women in London Credit: PA:Press Association

Yet it's not just London the Albanians have infiltrated.

They have also turned Essex into a European crime hotspot, while The Sun revealed last year how an Albanian gang operated a “Deliveroo for drugs” in leafy Tunbridge Wells, Kent.

Some Albanian gangsters reach Britain using false papers or hidden in the backs of lorries. Others are thought to be the kids of migrants who came to the UK as asylum seekers in the late 1990s.

The ruthless Somali street gangsters

Turf: North-East London

Somalian gangsters have also become notorious in London due to their brutality.

In the north-east district of Walthamstow, the highly sophisticated Mali Boys, drawn mainly from the Somali community, run a terrifying campaign of drug dealing, violence and intimidation.

They are said to be the “most business-driven, violent and ruthless” type of gang, shunning social media in favour of keeping their activities a secret and remaining anonymous to police.

They use old fashioned Nokia phones because they are less easy to track.

36 Forensic officers investigate the scene of a shooting on Vallentin Road in Walthamstow, which is in the catchment area of six gangs - including the Somali 'Mali Boys' gang Credit: Dan Jones - The Sun

36 Resident Ovidiu Bujor, pictured, told The Sun last year he is worried about his family Credit: �2018 Gustavo Valiente / i-Images

The Mali Boys' bosses originally came to Britain as children from war-torn Somalia, with police saying in 2018 they were earning up to £50,000 a week from drug sales.

One rival gang member told The Sun the group was "a whole new entity"

“Those people come from countries where there are pirates, where people are gang-raped and beaten up, and it’s all in front of them," said the source.

"Some are ex-soldiers who have seen people’s heads blown off.

"So they feel they can come and do it here."

Among the Mali Boys' turf is Walthamstow's Vallentin Road - dubbed 'Britain's most dangerous street' thanks to a string of violent attacks including fatal shootings and arson.

36 A dozen gangs are believed to be operating in the Waltham Forest area

36 Floral tributes are left near Vallentin Road following a shooting in 2018 Credit: �2018 Gustavo Valiente / i-Images

The road is also in the catchment area of five other criminal gangs, and one local told us: "As a family we now want to make sure we’re home with the door locked for 7pm."

In 2016, Jamal Goole, 19, a member of the Mali Boys, stabbed rival gang member Saren Golden, 25, outside a chicken shop on Lea Bridge Road in Leyton with a broken wine bottle.

In a separate incident a decade earlier, a feud between rival Somali gangs from Camden, Tottenham and Edmonton led to teen Mahir Osman being beaten to death in a mob attack.

The Chilean 'burglary tourists'

Turf: All over London

Chilean gangsters have terrorised London in recent years - yet instead of murders, beatings or drug offences, they have become known for raiding homes.

More than 75 Chilean burglars have been arrested in the UK in two years alone for ransacking properties for luxury goods in cases of so-called "burglary tourism".

They are reported to have swiped jewellery, watches and designer clothes in a series of multi-million-pound raids in London and elsewhere in England and Wales.

36 A mugshot of Portilla-Astorga, who was jailed alongside Carvajal-Donaire and two other burglars for the raid on the Wareings' home Credit: PA:Press Association

36 Carvajal-Donaire, 20, was locked up for 40 months alongside his other gang members Credit: PA:Press Association

Earlier this month, four Chilean gangsters were jailed for the £33,000 raid on the Wareings' home, during which they snatched a gold Rolex and two luxury Omega watches.

A court heard they'd flown in from South America just days earlier, and that three orange dots were sprayed on the back fence to tell the burglars it was a high-value property.

Sentencing the burglars to three years and four months in prison each, the judge said: “No one here or abroad should be under an illusion that somehow the UK is a soft touch.

"Each of you came to this country with one purpose - crime.

"No other reason for your visit to the UK has been offered to me."

36 Three orange dots were sprayed on the back fence of the Wareings' south-west London mansion Credit: CPS

36 A stolen pendant from the couple's home Credit: CPS

36 Marcus, a judge on the BBC's MasterChef: the Professionals, lost a gold Rolex and two Omega watches Credit: BBC

In another recent case, a young man flying back to Chilean capital Santiago from Spain admitted a series of burglaries in and around London, the Daily Mail reports.

He was found to have more than £50,000 worth of diamonds on him.

Police believe the "burglary tourists" - many of whom have previous convictions for burglary or robbery - could be carrying out the legwork for London-based crime lords.

And it's easy for them to fly in - they don't need visas to visit Britain as "tourists" for up to three months.

The Bengali machete thugs

Turf: East End

Bengali gangs have also made their mark on the capital, after taking over its vibrant East End - where the borough of Tower Hamlets has been dubbed "a hotbed of teen gang violence".

The area has one of London's highest ethnic minority populations, made up mainly of people of Bangladeshi origin, who are among the UK's youngest and fastest-growing communities.

While most aren't involved in gangs, the street mobsters here are reported to be extremely territorial, dishing out "swift and brutal" violence to anyone who dares to step in their path.

They have fought rivals in the past with machetes, meat cleavers and baseball bats.

36 Gangsters have taken over the capital's vibrant East End. Above, Whitechapel in Tower Hamlets Credit: Alamy

An investigation in the Telegraph Magazine also found Bengali drug runners had flooded the East End's streets with cocaine and heroin - described as "the currency out of the ghetto".

In 2012, Bengali Londoner Udjal Kamrujzaman revealed the shocking violence of the local street gangs, recalling a night in the late 1990s where five different mobs clashed.

“All of the tendons in my hand were cut with a meat cleaver," he said, according to the New Statesman. "My friend’s ear and fingers were hanging off. I wasn’t sure if I was going to live."

Most Bengali gangsters are reported to be aged between 14 and 25, and solicitor Nick says: "One of the most unfortunate elements to this type of gang activity in London is the number of young people, male and female who are dragged in as workers or 'runners' for the gangs at a young age."



The Turkish-Cypriot mobsters

Turf: South London

In South London, a Turkish-Cypriot crime mob has carried out a reign of terror since the late 1960s, involving armed robbery, contract killing and drug trafficking.

Named the Arifs, the gangsters rose to notoriety as they filled a vacuum left by the downfall of the Kray twins, as well as the infamous Clerkenwell and Brindle families.

36 Bekir Arif, nicknamed 'The Duke', is part of a notorious London-based crime mob Credit: MET Police

36 Police raided a caravan in 2015 while investigating a £1.5 million drugs ring Credit: MET Police

By the 80s, they had become one of the most feared gangs in the capital.

And even decades later, in 2004, they were branded “Britain’s No1 crime family”.

Despite a series of arrests and successful convictions, the family are thought to have maintained ties with Turkey, with accomplices allegedly overseeing drugs shipments to mainland Europe.

The extent of their operations today is unclear.

But in 2016, London-based gang member Bekir Arif, nicknamed 'The Duke', was jailed for 11-and-a-half years for his role in a £1.5 million drugs ring.

36 Officers found an enormous haul of concealed drugs during the caravan raid Credit: MET Police

36 An older picture of Arif, who has convictions dating back to 1977

Arif, in his mid-60s, has convictions dating back to 1977 when he was imprisoned for his role in an armed robbery that resulted in the death of a security guard.

In 1999, he was jailed for 23 years for conspiracy to supply 100kg of heroin worth £12.5million.

He was the third of seven brothers to receive major prison terms.

Russian hit squads

Turf: Various parts of London

Russian criminals have been linked to a string of deaths and money-laundering crimes in London.

Just this month, it was claimed that a millionaire found impaled on railings below a £2 million flat in Marylebone, north-west London, in December 2014 was a fixer for a Russian mob.

Cops found that Scot Young, 52, had jumped to his death from the fourth-floor balcony, but an inquest returned an open verdict - with his family maintaining he was murdered.

Scot had close links to the now-deceased Boris Berezovsky, the exiled Russian oligarch who opposed President Vladimir Putin, and it is said he "fell in with a major organised crime group".

36 Scot Young, pictured with partner Noelle Reno, was found dead in December 2014. There is no suggestion that Noelle was involved in any criminal activity

36 He plunged onto railings below a £2 million Marylebone flat Credit: Rex Features

36 Scot had close links to the now-deceased Boris Berezovsky, pictured Credit: AP:Associated Press

But his isn't the only suspicious death on UK soil - a BuzzFeed News probe has linked 14 suspected assassinations to Russia, although they aren't necessarily connected to gangs.

Outside of London, there was also the Novichok poisoning of ex-Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his then-33-year-old daughter Yulia in Wiltshire in March 2018.

Aside from 'hits', Russian criminals have also hidden "dirty" money in British assets and laundered it through City of London financial institutions, according to UK lawmakers.

London has been described as the Western capital of choice for Russian officials and oligarchs who flaunt their wealth across Europe’s most luxurious destinations.

From the Nigerian mobile cons to the Italian Mafia...

Other foreign gangs who have been linked to London include Nigerian mobile cons, Jamaican Yardies and the 'under-the-radar' Italian Mafia, to name a few.

A Sun investigation revealed in 2018 how Nigerian crime lords are making millions from phones swiped by acid-armed moped thugs on UK streets.

We found the nicked mobiles were being sold to Nigeria’s tech-starved middle classes for up to £560 each after being shipped 4,500 miles from Britain.

36 Thousands of phones are stolen by London moped gangs every year Credit: J ALMASI

36 A Sun investigation found 'UK used' phones on sale at a Nigerian market in Lagos Credit: AFP

Nigerian criminals were also linked to London last year, when three siblings were convicted of laundering nearly £1 million through UK bank accounts for the Black Axe organised crime ring.

The trio, who lived in Greenwich, were working directly for the leader of the gang - which is banned in Nigeria and has been linked to murders, rapes, extortion and drug dealing, the CPS said.

Also in London, the Jamaican Yardies are reported to be continuing a violent legacy, with an IBTimes report claiming their influence "remains in the brutality of street gangs across London".

And members of the Italian Mafia have infiltrated the capital, too.

"The Mafia invest in real estate and illicit businesses," says University of Essex criminologist Dr Anna Sergi, who specialises in the Mafia, organised crime and drug trafficking.

"They hide in London as well. There are some Mafia people living in the UK unknown."

In 2013, infamous Mafia boss Domenico Rancadore, dubbed 'The Professor' was rumbled after 19 years on the run when he was found living in Uxbridge, west London, under the alias ‘Marco Skinner’.

He faced extradition to Italy but his case 'expired'. He is believed to remain in the UK.

36 Domenico Rancadore, dubbed 'The Professor', evaded Italian authorities for years Credit: Reuters

36 Rancadore had faced extradition but his case 'expired' Credit: Reuters

One foreign suspect arrested every 3 minutes

In recent years, shocking figures have shown that nearly a fifth of all crime suspects arrested by UK police are foreigners, with more than 172,000 detained in one year alone.

This equals an average of one arrest every three minutes, The Mail on Sunday reported.

The Home Office has warned that "any foreign national offender who poses a threat to the UK should be in no doubt of our determination to deport them".

In the 12 months leading up to July 2019, more than 5,000 foreign cons were kicked out - but The Sun on Sunday revealed in September that thousands more remain in our jails.

Many others are roaming the streets or running illicit trade in London from overseas.

36 Albanian killer Ardian Rragami, pictured attacking his wife, was deported in March last year Credit: Louis Wood - The Sun

Top stories in news HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

And, as Neil warns, the gangsters' crimes are becoming more brutal every year.

"The most successful gangster is the one who can intimate an entire community," says the former cop, who spent 14 years infiltrating Britain's drugs gangs and is now a board member for the Law Enforcement Action Partnership.

"The main tool for police is the use of an informant. When someone gets caught and they're in their police cell and know they're going to be offered a deal, they're thinking 'who am I least scared of?'

"Being the most violent makes you the most safe."
summary:
TWO shameless Chilean gangsters pose in gold necklaces after jetting into Britain and ransacking celebrity chef Marcus Wareing's £5 million London home.
Gangs fighting for turfHe adds: "London has become a hotbed for the gang-controlled drug markets.
Some Albanian gangsters reach Britain using false papers or hidden in the backs of lorries.
Also in London, the Jamaican Yardies are reported to be continuing a violent legacy, with an IBTimes report claiming their influence "remains in the brutality of street gangs across London".
"The most successful gangster is the one who can intimate an entire community," says the former cop, who spent 14 years infiltrating Britain's drugs gangs and is now a board member for the Law Enforcement Action Partnership.

title: Slain Capitol cop William ‘Billy’ Evans lies in honor at Rotunda & is praised as hero who put safety of others first
text:
THE slain Capitol cop laid in honor at the Rotunda and was praised as a hero who put the safety of others first.

President Joe Biden attended the ceremony for William "Billy" Evans, 41, who was killed after a knife-wielding man rammed the barricades of the Capitol lawn with his vehicle.

25 William 'Billy' Evans, who had two young children, was an 18-year veteran of the force Credit: AP

25 The coffin was draped with the American flag Credit: Getty

25 Biden spoke at the ceremony Credit: AP

25 Family and friends watched on as the cop's hearse was carried up the steps Credit: Reuters

25 Logan, left, and Abigail, the children of Evans look at the program with a photo of their father Credit: AFP

25 President Joe Biden presents a challenge coin to Logan Evans, son of William 'Billy' Evans Credit: AFP

25 Evans was killed when a vehicle rammed into him at a barricade just 100 yards from the Senate side of the Capitol Credit: EPA

The driver, Noah Green, 25, was shot dead by cops and investigators believe he had been delusional and having suicidal thoughts.

Evans, who had two young children, was an 18-year veteran of the force.

The president said: "He was the one who always kept his word. He was the one who, just like the folks I grew up with, wasn't capable of saying no when you needed him."

"Your dad is a hero," Biden told the children. ."It's in your blood," before adding "the moment of the smile comes without the tear."

Ahead of today's service, a statement from US Capitol Police said: "As we mourn the loss of Officer Billy Evans, we are grateful for the honor bestowed upon him by Congress."

US Capitol cops gathered outside the building and lined the streets as the hearse carrying the body of Evans entered the Capitol grounds around 10.30am.

Family and friends stood at the top of the steps of the Capitol building as his coffin, draped in the American flag, was removed from the hearse.

During the ceremony, the Chaplain of the United States Senate said they are experiencing "anger, confusion and fear" over the loss of "a son, a father, a friend, and a partner."

25 Evans coffin arrives for the memorial service Credit: AFP

25 Logan and Abigail, the children of Evans, are comforted by their mum Shannon Terranova at a memorial service Credit: AFP

25 The family of Billy Evans were at the ceremony Credit: Reuters

25 Biden presenting a challenge coin to Logan Evans Credit: AP

25 Capitol Police officers look at a program prior to a ceremony honoring Evans Credit: AFP

Paying tribute to Evans' children, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said: "Logan and Abigail, no words are adequate. We can only imagine your sadness.

"So many know about your dad and know he is a hero - his name will always be on our lips and in our hearts."

Rep. Tim Ryan, who heads a committee which oversees the Capitol Police, said: "The loss of Officer Evans is yet another stark reminder of what our brothers and sisters in uniform risk every day to protect us.

"The honor of lying in state under the Capitol dome is befitting of this American hero."

Paying tribute to Evans, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy tweeted: "With heavy hearts and in recognition of his courage and sacrifice, a grateful nation bids farewell to Officer Billy Evans, a true hero.

"His loss is enormous - our prayers are with his two children, his families, and his colleagues in Capitol Police."

Last night, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said: "On April 2, a senseless attack on the Capitol claimed the life of Officer William 'Billy' Evans.

25 Evans family looks on as his casket is carried into the US Capitol Credit: EPA

25 The hearse arriving at the US Capitol on Tuesday morning Credit: Reuters

25 House Speaker Nancy Pelosi greeted Evans' children Credit: AP

25 The death of Evans was described as a 'yet another stark reminder of what our brothers and sisters in uniform risk every day to protect us' Credit: Reuters

25 President Joe Biden speaks during the ceremony to honour Evans Credit: AP

25 US Capitol police officers gather prior to a ceremony honoring fellow officer William Evans Credit: Reuters

25 The driver of the car, Noah Green, 25, was shot dead by cops Credit: EPA

"Officer Evans will lie in honor under the Capitol rotunda, at the very center of the democracy he gave his life to protect."

On Tuesday he added: "Officers are approached by hundreds of lost tourists a day, lucky ones bump into Billy" before dubbing him a "fellow of infinite jest."

"Billy was a man of many crews - one you'd want to be stationed with," Schumer added, before saying Evans received "joy and laughter out of life's smallest moments."

"Those of you who remember Billy need to speak his name," he finalized.

Senator Elizabeth Warren said Evans "made the ultimate sacrifice to protect our Capitol".

"We are forever in his debt," she said.

In a statement earlier this month, his family said his two children - Logan and Abigail - were the most important thing in his life.

He was remembered by colleagues and friends as a man with a sense of humor who loved baseball and golf.

"His most cherished moments were those spent with them building with Lego, having lightsaber duels, playing board games, doing arts and crafts, and recently finishing the Harry Potter series," the family said.

"He was always so eager to show how proud he was of everything they did."

25 Evans was remembered by colleagues and friends as a man with a sense of humor who loved baseball and golf Credit: AP

25 The casket containing Evans body is carried into the Capitol to lie in honor in the Rotunda Credit: Getty

25 Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell and House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy arrive with Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi Credit: Reuters

25 President Joe Biden and Speaker Nancy Pelosi arrive at the memorial service Credit: AFP

25 District of Columbia Mayor Muriel Bowser waits for slain US Capitol Police officer William Evans to lie in honor Credit: Reuters

25 The guard booth at the North entrance to the US Capitol draped with black cloth Credit: EPA

The family said Evans was proud of his job - and his friendship with colleagues near the "North Barricade" of the Capitol complex was one of the best parts of it.

"We hold them in our hearts, as we know they acutely share our grief," they said.

On the Senate floor on Monday evening, Senator Dick Durbin, said Evans was a "familiar and friendly face" at the barricade where he was killed.

"Every day it is incumbent on those of us who work in this building to remember this officer, and to thank him, and the men and women of the U.S. Capitol Police who have given so much to keep us safe," Durbin said.

Evans death came just three months after a violent mob of Trump supporters stormed the Capitol, injuring dozens of Capitol Police officers.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

Officer Brian Sicknick died during the carange and two men have been arrested and charged with assaulting him with bear spray.

Sicknick and Evans are two of only six Capitol Police officers who have been killed in the line of duty in the forces nearly 200-year history, according to the department.

Another cop, Howard Liebengood, took his own life in the days after January 6, Associated Press reports.
summary:
THE slain Capitol cop laid in honor at the Rotunda and was praised as a hero who put the safety of others first.
President Joe Biden attended the ceremony for William "Billy" Evans, 41, who was killed after a knife-wielding man rammed the barricades of the Capitol lawn with his vehicle.
Ahead of today's service, a statement from US Capitol Police said: "As we mourn the loss of Officer Billy Evans, we are grateful for the honor bestowed upon him by Congress."
Paying tribute to Evans, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy tweeted: "With heavy hearts and in recognition of his courage and sacrifice, a grateful nation bids farewell to Officer Billy Evans, a true hero.
Last night, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said: "On April 2, a senseless attack on the Capitol claimed the life of Officer William 'Billy' Evans.

title: Josh Duggar’s cousin Amy shares eerie cryptic post after being left ‘speechless’ by his arrest and child porn charges
text:
JOSH Duggar's cousin Amy King added mystery to the mix with a cryptic Twitter post following her relative's arrest for child porn.

The businesswoman previously took to her page to state a "tornado" was coming to "destroy everything" hours before the 33-year-old was booked for the serious offenses.

Read our Josh Duggar live blog for the latest updates

13 Josh Duggar's cousin Amy posted a cryptic Twitter gif following his arrest for child porn Credit: @amyduggar/Twitter

13 The boutique owner took to her Twitter page to warn of a 'tornado' about to hit her family shortly prior to Josh's arrest Credit: Instagram

Mom Amy then exclusively opened up to The Sun telling how she was "devastated" by Josh's child porn charges, which he has denied.

Josh, who is married to Anna Duggar, was charged with one count of possession of a child pornographic photo and a second count of receiving a child pornographic photo on Friday.

The charges came after he was arrested on Thursday in Arkansas.

At his arraignment in court on Friday, Josh pleaded not guilty to the charges, and was ordered to remain in custody until at least May 5.

13 She exclusively told The Sun she was 'devastated' by the allegations Credit: Instagram

13 Josh, pictured with wife Anna, has pleaded not guilty to the charges Credit: Getty - Contributor

Amy, 34, today posted a new message that added more fuel to the fire among her Twitter followers, depicting a sad Emoji face and a gif of a raindrop or tear falling into a pond.

The droplet was seen causing a huge amount of ripples - perhaps referencing the wide-ranging after-effects of Josh's arrest.

Josh's brother-in-law Derick Dillard has already appeared to agree with fans claiming TLC show Counting On, which stars Josh's family but not Josh, should be scrapped.

Amy's followers appeared divided with the meaning of her picture-post, with some believing the teardrop was a representation of her own sadness.

13 Many fans believed Amy's teardrop post with ripples reflected her own sadness Credit: Instagram

13 The mom, here with her husband Dillon King, simply added a caption of a sad faced Emoji Credit: Instagram

One wrote: "Hugs to you and your family. Take care and will be praying for all. Sad for so many people."

Another posted: "Prayers for you and your family. 🙏."

One then replied: "Sending so much love and support yalls way."

Yet one took the opposite stance, and commented: "Hopefully his family doesn’t try to sweep this one under the rug."

13 Amy was first to tell The Sun she was 'speechless' after Josh's arrest Credit: Instagram

13 Amy said the whole family 'hoped' the allegations were 'not true' Credit: Instagram

Amy previously exclusively told The Sun she is “devastated” by the arrest on Friday.

She said: “At the moment I have no comment to make. I’m kind of speechless, we just hope it’s not true.

“I spoke with several of my cousins after we heard about the arrest. We’re in shock, but we don’t want to think the worst of someone, you want to think the best.

“If it is true it would absolutely devastate a lot of people.”

13 Talking of the situation, Amy said 'it breaks my heart' Credit: Instagram

Amy, who is married to Dillon King, continued: “Everybody that knows Josh would be devastated. Just thinking about it makes me want to have a glass of wine right now.”

She added that her “hugs” go out to Josh’s pregnant wife Anna, 32, and their six children.

The clothing boutique owner ended: “It breaks my heart. Family is family and I wish the best for everyone.”

13 Amy sent her 'hugs' to Josh's wife Anna Credit: Instagram

13 Mom of six Anna is expecting her seventh child with Josh in the fall Credit: Instagram/Anna Duggar

The Duggar family additionally released a statement that read: “We appreciate your continued prayers for our family at this time. The accusations brought against Joshua today are very serious.

"It is our prayer that the truth, no matter what it is, will come to light, and that this will all be resolved in a timely manner.

"We love Josh and Anna and continue to pray for their family.”

According to the indictment, Josh “knowingly received child pornography” between or about May 14, 2019 and on or about May 16, 2019.

For the second count, Josh “knowingly possessed material that contained images of child pornography,” including “images of minors under the age of 12.”

13 TV images show Josh being booked into jail after his arrest Credit: News Nation Now

13 If convicted, Josh could receive 20 years in prison Credit: News Nation Now

Most read in Entertainment Live Blog COP OUT Line of Duty finale bombshell as H's identity finally revealed HARD TIME The Line of Duty cast look very different to when they started acting 'MIND BLOWN' Line Of Duty fans shocked to discover Scot Martin Compston's real accent 'arry at the Queen Vic Harry Redknapp is pictured arriving at EastEnders set to film scenes OUT OUT Ex-EastEnders star Melissa Suffield has her first boozy night without her baby son haunting Kate Garraway told a 'good recovery' for Derek would mean 'he'd hold a hairbrush'

Josh has been ordered to forfeit all visual images and property, including video equipment, related to the case.

According to a press release from the Department of Justice, Josh “allegedly used the internet to download child sexual abuse material. Duggar allegedly possessed this material, some of which depicts the sexual abuse of children under the age of 12, in May 2019.”

If convicted, he could receive 20 years in prison with fines up to $250,000 on each count.
summary:
JOSH Duggar's cousin Amy King added mystery to the mix with a cryptic Twitter post following her relative's arrest for child porn.
The droplet was seen causing a huge amount of ripples - perhaps referencing the wide-ranging after-effects of Josh's arrest.
Josh's brother-in-law Derick Dillard has already appeared to agree with fans claiming TLC show Counting On, which stars Josh's family but not Josh, should be scrapped.
13 Amy was first to tell The Sun she was 'speechless' after Josh's arrest Credit: Instagram13 Amy said the whole family 'hoped' the allegations were 'not true' Credit: InstagramAmy previously exclusively told The Sun she is “devastated” by the arrest on Friday.
According to a press release from the Department of Justice, Josh “allegedly used the internet to download child sexual abuse material.

title: Who is Derek Chauvin’s wife Kellie Chauvin?
text:
KELLIE Chauvin is the ex-wife of Derek Chauvin, the Minnesota police officer found guilty of killing George Floyd.

On April 20, Derek Chauvin, 45, was convicted of all three murder and manslaughter charges against him.

Read our Derek Chauvin trial live blog for the latest updates

2 Kellie Chauvin is the wife of killer cop Derek Chauvin Credit: Enterprise

Who is Kellie Chauvin?

Kellie Chauvin was Derek Chauvin's wife.

Derek was found guilty of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter in the death of George Floyd.

The judge announced the jury's verdict at just after 4pm local time on April 20. Following the news, Chauvin was seen being led from the court in handcuffs.

He is now on suicide watch in a maximum security jail and faces a sentence of up to 75 years in prison.

Kellie divorced Derek shortly after he was charged over Floyd's death. They do not have any children together.

Kellie, 46, was born in Laos in 1974. Her family fled to Thailand in 1977 following the war.

She's a former radiologist and beauty queen, who won the title of Mrs Minnesota in 2018.

According to Twin Cities, Kellie entered the pageant at the urging of a pal.

Kellie explained that she wanted to represent the Hmong community, as she had been bullied as a child for her heritage, appearance, and refugee status.

She has given financial help to several Hmong nonprofits and small businesses.

The mum-of-two has also volunteered as a translator at local hospitals, along with making her home a “safe haven” for Hmong women going through difficult times.

2 A street artist paints a mural for George Floyd in Idlib, Syria Credit: EPA

She said: “I help them find housing and jobs and provide resources they need to succeed.

“It really just takes one person to make a difference.”

Vantu News said that Kellie's most recent job was selling homes for estate agent Re/Max.

Her estranged husband, white police officer Derek Chauvin, was caught on camera, kneeling on George Floyd's neck for nine minutes, stopping him from breathing until he died.

Floyd could be heard pleading “I can’t breathe” while Chauvin ignored bystanders' pleas to get off his neck.

Chauvin was fired from the Minneapolis police department and his wife left him.

Three other officers involved in the arrest were also fired.

Kellie Chauvin, winner of the 2018 Mrs Minnesota beauty pageant Credit: Facebook

What has Kellie Chauvin said about George Floyd's death?

A distressed Kellie Chauvin released a statement via her Minneapolis lawyer, Sekula Law Offices, at the time of Floyd's death.

It says: "Kellie is devastated by Mr Floyd’s death and her utmost sympathy lies with his family, with his loved ones, and with everyone who is grieving this tragedy.

"She has filed for dissolution of her marriage to Derek Chauvin.

"While Ms Chauvin has no children from her current marriage, she respectfully requests that her children, her elder parents, and her extended family be given safety and privacy during this difficult time."

Her comments attracted sympathy on Facebook, with the likes of Addison Steiner posting: "Kellie is a friend of mine. I knew her before she married Derek.

"She is a kind, gentle and compassionate woman. Prayers for her."

Marilyn Sychra added: "I pray for peace and solace for this lady. She had nothing to do with the actions against Mr. Floyd."

Brandi Cross posted: "My prayers go out to you Kellie as well.

"Your life changed in an instant and is over as you once knew it."

Why are Derek and Kellie Chauvin divorcing?

Kellie Chauvin filed for divorce from Derek Chauvin on May 28, 2020, three days after the horrific death of George Floyd.

The former Mrs Minnesota said “irretrievable breakdown” of their relationship was to blame for ending their 10-year marriage.

According to court papers obtained by The Sun, Kellie said in a court filing that she doesn’t want any money or financial help from her cop ex, despite being an unemployed estate agent.

“[The] respondent is fully capable of supporting herself,” the filing states.

Both Kellie and her estranged hubby waived their rights to "temporary or permanent spousal maintenance," from each other, according to the court papers.

Former police officer Derek Chauvin poses for a booking photograph at Hennepin County Jail in Minneapolis, US Credit: Reuters

When did they get married and do they have children?

Kellie married Derek Chauvin in 2010, after the pair met and fell in love while she was working as a radiologist at a hospital.

She told the St Paul Pioneer Press that they met when he dropped off a suspect at a Minneapolis hospital where she worked.

The couple don't have any children, but Kellie does have two kids from her previous relationship with ex-husband Kujay Xiong.

Minneapolis City Council records show that Derek Chauvin moonlighted as a bouncer at a downtown Latin nightclub before he joined the police.

MORE ON GEORGE FLOYD CLASS CHAOS Teacher removed after calling George Floyd a 'f*****g criminal' during lesson 'BURN IT DOWN!' Rioter who set fire to precinct in Floyd protests & filmed it fined $12M Revealed PLAN B Feds 'had secret plan to arrest Chauvin IMMEDIATELY if he was cleared of murder' 'LIKE FLOYD'S DEATH' Mario Gonzalez death - why he was arrested and what the body cam shows LAST BREATHS Shocking moment cops kneel on Latino dad for FIVE MINUTES before he dies SECONDS BEFORE KILLING 'Militarized' cops rush to Andrew Brown's home before shooting

Kellie said: "Under that uniform, he's just a softie. He's such a gentleman.

"He still opens the door for me, still puts my coat on for me.

"After my [previous] divorce, I had a list of must-haves if I were ever to be in a relationship, and he fit all of them."
summary:
KELLIE Chauvin is the ex-wife of Derek Chauvin, the Minnesota police officer found guilty of killing George Floyd.
Read our Derek Chauvin trial live blog for the latest updates2 Kellie Chauvin is the wife of killer cop Derek Chauvin Credit: EnterpriseWho is Kellie Chauvin?
Kellie Chauvin was Derek Chauvin's wife.
Kellie Chauvin, winner of the 2018 Mrs Minnesota beauty pageant Credit: FacebookWhat has Kellie Chauvin said about George Floyd's death?
Kellie Chauvin filed for divorce from Derek Chauvin on May 28, 2020, three days after the horrific death of George Floyd.

title: Woman, 29, found stabbed to death in Leicester cul-de-sac is pictured
text:
A WOMAN who was found stabbed to death in a Leicester cul-de-sac has been pictured.

Geetika Goyal, 29, was found with stab wounds in Uppingham Close, Leics., in the early hours of yesterday and was pronounced dead at the scene.

2 Geetika Goyal was found stabbed to death in Leicester on Thursday Credit: Leicester Police

Leicestershire Police confirmed a 28-year-old man from Leicester has been arrested on suspicion of murder and he remains in police custody.

The force said enquires into Geetika's death are ongoing as they probe the area for clues - checking CCTV and making house to house enquiries.

Detective Inspector Jenni Heggs, of the East Midlands Special Operations Unit, said: “A dedicated team has been carrying out enquiries since yesterday morning to establish the full circumstances of Geetika’s death and how this has happened and we continue to appeal to anyone with any information to make contact with us.

“Officers remain with Geetika’s family providing full support. A man arrested on suspicion of murder currently remains in police custody."

Cops cordoned off Uppingham Close yesterday and a scene preservation was removed yesterday evening.

Another remains in place at a property in Wintersdale Road as part of enquiries.

2 Geetika was found dead in Uppingham Close, in Leicester Credit: Google

In a statement last night, police said: "Officers were called by a member of the public to the area at 2.25am after a 29-year-old woman was found injured lying on the pavement in the street.

"Police and East Midlands Ambulance Service attended. Sadly the woman was pronounced dead at the scene."

Meanwhile, residents told of their shock after hearing the news.

A pensioner, who did not wish be named, who lives opposite the spot where the tragic 29-year-old was discovered, told the Sun: “It’s a terrible thing to happen and out hearts go out to the poor girl’s family.

"I’ve lived here for many years, it’s a nice safe area and nothing bad ever happens here. There’s never any trouble and we’re all in a state of disbelief.”

She added: “The first we knew about the murder was when police came knocking on our door. They’ve been here all day making inquiries and carrying out forensics examination. It's right across from my front door.

"We don’t know who she is and don’t believe she lives in the street but it’s an unusual place to be and it’s not a short cut to anywhere. There is a foot path leading from the main road.”

Another householder said: "Police have been making door to door enquiries and told everyone to stay in their homes. One man was taking his wheelie bin outside but was asked to go back inside.

“It’s shocking and we’re just relieved that a suspect has been arrested.”

Cops are now urging anyone with information to come forward.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

DI Heggs said: “We urge anyone who was in Uppingham Close, Wintersdale Road or the surrounding area, including Uppingham Road, between 5pm on Wednesday and 2.25am on Thursday to think back to anything you saw or heard which could assist our enquiries.

"Please make contact if you have not already done so. If you have any CCTV or dashcam footage from the area, you should also get in touch with us."

Anyone with any information should contact 101 quoting incident 29 of 4 March.
summary:
A WOMAN who was found stabbed to death in a Leicester cul-de-sac has been pictured.
Geetika Goyal, 29, was found with stab wounds in Uppingham Close, Leics., in the early hours of yesterday and was pronounced dead at the scene.
2 Geetika Goyal was found stabbed to death in Leicester on Thursday Credit: Leicester PoliceLeicestershire Police confirmed a 28-year-old man from Leicester has been arrested on suspicion of murder and he remains in police custody.
The force said enquires into Geetika's death are ongoing as they probe the area for clues - checking CCTV and making house to house enquiries.
Cops cordoned off Uppingham Close yesterday and a scene preservation was removed yesterday evening.

title: Rochdale grooming gang members still roam city where they abused children despite losing right to remain in UK – The Sun
text:
THREE members of the sick Rochdale grooming gang continue to roam the streets in the same city where they abused girls as young as 12, despite losing the right to remain in the UK.

One of the gang's former victims spoke of her betrayal to find one of the men, a father-of-five and taxi driver, is back living near her in Greater Manchester - the same area where the horrific crimes where perpetrated.

The three members of the Rochdale child sex grooming gang (from left to right) Adil Khan, Abdul Aziz and Qari Abdul Rauf have all served their sentences Credit: PA:Press Association

Pictures emerged on social media showing Abdul Rauf, 51, in the Lancashire town, two years after losing the right to stay in Britain.

Concerned Rochdale residents shared the images with friends and family.

Two other grooming gang members - Abdul Aziz, 49, and Adil Khan, 50 - reportedly live nearby.

SPOTTED IN TOWN

One of the gang's victims told the Mirror: “I thought Theresa May had organised his deportation, so how come he’s still here?

"I feel violated to know he’s living near me – in the same area where he hunted for girls like me.

“It’s a total betrayal of grooming victims that he’s allowed to stay.”

I feel violated to know he's living near me – in the same area where he hunted for girls like me. Victim

The Rochdale child sex abuse ring was run by a group of men from Rochdale and Oldham, who exploited girls as young as 12.

Nine men were eventually jailed for a string of offences in 2012.

The vile group were initially given sentences ranging from four to 19 years after being found guilty of offences including rape and conspiracy to engage in sexual activity with a child.

The court heard how the men - eight of Pakistani origin and one from Afghanistan - gave their victims drink and drugs before “passing them” round for sex.

The abuse took place at two takeaway restaurants- now under new management - in the Heywood area of Rochdale by the men aged between 24 and 59.

Four members of the grooming gang – including ringleader Shabir Ahmed – faced deportation to Pakistan having dual British and Pakistani citizenship.

In 2016, then-home secretary Theresa May ruled it would be "conducive to the public good" to deprive the four of the right to remain in the UK.

They then fought, and lost, a long legal battle against deprivation of UK citizenship, losing a final Court of Appeal ruling in 2018.

Sentencing judge Gerald Clifton said the victims were "raped callously, viciously and violently".

STILL IN BRITAIN

In June 2019, four of the group were revealed to be still living in Britain, with no signs of any being prepared for deportation to Pakistan.

One of the men, Abdul Rauf, 51, is a father of five, a taxi driver and a former teacher at a mosque.

His sentence was six years for trafficking and sex with a girl, who was aged 15.

Abdul Aziz, 49, is a father of three and carried the more sinister title of 'The Master'.

He was originally sentenced to nine years for trafficking and conspiracy to engage in sex with a child.

Adil Khan, 50, was given eight years for conspiracy and trafficking a 13-year-old girl who later became pregnant.

All three men have served their sentences.

The exposure of the grooming, sexual assault and trafficking of young girls in Rochdale was made public in 2012.

MOST READ IN NEWS HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

Police identified and interviewed 47 young girls who were potential victims of the gang.

After the gang was eventually jailed police, the Rochdale Safeguarding Children Board highlighted failures by 17 agencies who were meant to protect the children.

Crown prosecutors and the Rochdale Council were forced to apologise for their failings.

It led police forces across the country to change the way that they deal with missing people.

SICK GROOMING GANG Ahmed, known as "Daddy", was the ringleader of the gang. He is still serving a 22-year jail term for rape. Former taxi driver Aziz, a father-of-three, regularly took his young victim to different flats around Rochdale, where she was plied with cannabis and vodka and coerced into sex with men who paid him cash. Referred to as "The Master" by the gang, he played a "leading role" in the grooming. Jailed for nine years in May 2012, he was released in December 2015 after serving three years and seven months. Rauf, a father-of-five, trafficked a 15-year-old girl for sex, driving her to secluded areas to have sex with her in his taxi and ferry her to a flat in Rochdale where he and others had sex with her. He was jailed for six years and released in November 2014 after serving two years and six months of his sentence. A neighbour said he has a night-time driving job. Khan got a girl, 13, pregnant but denied he was the father then met another girl, 15, and trafficked her to others using violence when she complained. He was sentenced to eight years, released in 2016 and was last known to be living in Manchester. For two years from early 2008, girls as young as 12 were plied with alcohol and drugs and gang-raped in rooms above takeaway shops and ferried to different flats in taxis where cash was paid to use the girls. Police said as many as 47 girls were groomed.

Qari Abdul Rauf, 51, is a father of five, a taxi driver and a former teacher at a mosque who was sentenced to six years behind bars Credit: PA:Press Association

Abdul Aziz, 49, is a father of three and was originally sentenced to nine years for trafficking and conspiracy to engage in sex with a child Credit: PA:Press Association

Adil Khan, 50, was given eight years for conspiracy and trafficking a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant Credit: PA:Press Association

1 Top row, left to right, Abdul Rauf, Hamid Safi, Mohammed Sajid and Abdul Aziz; bottom row, left to right, Abdul Qayyum, Adil Khan, Mohammed Amin and Kabeer Hassan Credit: PA:Press Association

One of the Rochdale sex assault victims of Three Girls speaks about horror

We pay for your stories! Do you have a story for The Sun Online news team? Email us at tips@the-sun.co.uk or call 0207 782 4368. You can WhatsApp us on 07810 791 502. We pay for videos too. Click here to upload yours.
summary:
THREE members of the sick Rochdale grooming gang continue to roam the streets in the same city where they abused girls as young as 12, despite losing the right to remain in the UK.
Two other grooming gang members - Abdul Aziz, 49, and Adil Khan, 50 - reportedly live nearby.
Four members of the grooming gang – including ringleader Shabir Ahmed – faced deportation to Pakistan having dual British and Pakistani citizenship.
One of the men, Abdul Rauf, 51, is a father of five, a taxi driver and a former teacher at a mosque.
SICK GROOMING GANG Ahmed, known as "Daddy", was the ringleader of the gang.

title: What happened to Christopher on NCIS New Orleans?
text:
NCIS New Orleans fans were left shocked to learn agent Christopher LaSelle would not be appearing in the last episodes of season seven.

Season seven is the final season of the show, with the series finale is set to air Sunday, May 16, 2021.

5 Lucas Black played Christopher LaSelle on NCIS New Orleans Credit: Getty Images - Getty

What happened to Christopher on NCIS New Orleans?

In season six of NCIS New Orleans, agent Christopher LaSelle was shockingly killed in a mission gone wrong.

In episode Matthew 5:9, LaSelle died trying to avenge his brother's murder. He followed a trail of drug dealers, whom he linked to Cade's death down to Alabama.

Upon arriving to a cabin that he thought held clues about his brother's death, he was ambushed and murdered.

5 Lasalle hoped to avenge his brother's murder by tracking a drug ring in Alabama he believed was responsible Credit: Getty Images - Getty

LaSelle followed an assailant who pulled a gun on an innocent woman, only to be fatally shot in his arm and stomach.

In his final few moments, viewers see a dream sequence where LaSelle is reunited with his brother.

What did Lucas Black say about Christopher LaSelle's death?

Actor Lucas Black had been playing agent LaSelle for seven years since he joined the cast in 2014.

After his character was killed off in the series, he took to Instagram to explain more of his decision to leave and his next ventures.

“Well, that's all she wrote for Agent LaSalle, but I wanted to take this time personally to thank all of you fans out there for your love and support," he began.

“You were there to celebrate the victories and to pick me up when I needed it and I appreciate that."

5 Agent LaSelle dies in episode Matthew 5:9 Credit: Getty Images - Getty

"I want to say what an honour it was to play this character. I learned a lot about what the first responders do. Much respect to you guys.

“Also I support the military and appreciate what you guys do for us. Living in this wonderful country.

“A chapter has ended. What a great journey it was. Thank you guys so much. May God bless you," he concluded.

In another YouTube video, Black revealed he would be spending more time with his family now that his stint as agent LaSelle had come to an end.

He said: "The show has been so good to me over the years. Exceeded my expectations and goals.

5 Agent LaSelle suffered fatal gunshot wounds to his chest and arm on the show Credit: Getty Images - Getty

“But this job isn't easy for me. There's a lot of priorities in my life that get sacrificed for me to be here.

“But it's time for me to focus on those priorities in my life."

Black didn't reveal anything about his next acting roles. He is active on social media and regularly discusses his faith and love for the outdoors.

Will there be an eighth season of NCIS New Orleans?

The seventh season of NCIS New Orleans will sadly be the show's last.

"NCIS: New Orleans is averaging 4.8 million total viewers and a 0.5 demo rating (in Live+Same Day numbers) — down 24 percent from its Season 6 averages," reported TV Line.

Among the 12 dramas airing on CBS, NCIS New Orleans ranks ninths in it's measures.

5 NCIS New Orleans started in 2014 and will end in 2021 Credit: Getty Images - Getty

Most read in Entertainment Live Blog COP OUT Line of Duty finale bombshell as H's identity finally revealed HARD TIME The Line of Duty cast look very different to when they started acting 'MIND BLOWN' Line Of Duty fans shocked to discover Scot Martin Compston's real accent 'arry at the Queen Vic Harry Redknapp is pictured arriving at EastEnders set to film scenes OUT OUT Ex-EastEnders star Melissa Suffield has her first boozy night without her baby son haunting Kate Garraway told a 'good recovery' for Derek would mean 'he'd hold a hairbrush'

“It has been our sincere pleasure and honor to work on this show and with this incredible cast and crew for over 150 episodes,” co-showrunners and executive producers Jan Nash and Christopher Silber said in a statement.

“As disappointed as we are to see NOLA end, we couldn’t be prouder of the work we’ve done and are grateful to the spectacular and resilient Crescent City that embraced us for seven wonderful years.”

The news comes as it was reported that CBS is working on a third spin off in the NCIS franchise set in Hawaii.
summary:
NCIS New Orleans fans were left shocked to learn agent Christopher LaSelle would not be appearing in the last episodes of season seven.
5 Lucas Black played Christopher LaSelle on NCIS New Orleans Credit: Getty Images - GettyWhat happened to Christopher on NCIS New Orleans?
In season six of NCIS New Orleans, agent Christopher LaSelle was shockingly killed in a mission gone wrong.
The seventh season of NCIS New Orleans will sadly be the show's last.
Among the 12 dramas airing on CBS, NCIS New Orleans ranks ninths in it's measures.

title: Girl, 16, ‘gang raped by 30 men as suspects filmed attack in Red Sea resort hotel’
text:
A TEENAGE girl has allegedly been gang raped by 30 men as the suspects filmed the attack in a resort on the Red Sea.

Detectives have launched an urgent investigation into the attack which allegedly occurred in a hotel room in Eilat, Israel.

9 The alleged attack occurred in a hotel room in the town of Eilat, Israel Credit: Alamy

9 National outrage has swept Israel over the alleged attack Credit: Rex Features

Police said the victim is believed to have been intoxicated and was raped after going to use the bathroom at the Red Sea Hotel.

She is thought not to have been a guest at the hotel, but to have been socialising there with a group of friends,

Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu branded the attack as a "crime against humanity" and it has sparked nationwide outrage.

Thousands of people have taken to the streets protesting as they called for justice for the teenager.

They carried banners saying "we won't be silent anymore" and "we believe you".

The girl reported the attack on Friday, and two 27-year-old men from Hadera have been arrested.

Police have said they expect to make further arrests after assigning a special squad to the case.

One of the men reportedly told investigators that more than 30 men had sex with the girl, but he denied rape.

Men allegedly lined up outside the hotel room and patiently waited for their turn to rape the victim.

One of the girl's friends is said to have tried but failed to intervene to stop the alleged rape, and other witnesses allegedly simply ignored the attack.

Haaretz reports that some of the alleged perpetrators filmed the attack using the mobile phones.

Writing on Twitter, Mr Netanyahu said: “This is shocking, there is no other word.

“This is not only a crime against the girl, this is a crime against humanity itself that is worthy of all condemnation and those responsible must be brought to justice.”

9 Fury is mounting over the attack as thousands hit the streets Credit: Rex Features

9 Nine out of 10 rape cases in Israel are closed by prosecutors without charge Credit: Rex Features

9 Protesters show they are 'gagged' in a message to the authorities Credit: Rex Features

Video of the assault is reported to have featured in a later exchange of messages between the girl and one of the men who has been arrested.

The man denied sending the messages and said another person had sent them using his mobile phone.

She told police: "The following day, one of the young men approached me and told me that he has videos.

"He asked if I wanted him to send them to me, but I wasn’t capable of handling it."

The victim has said she is encouraged by the support from the public as protests sweep Israel, but is unable to ignore trolls online who have jumped on the case, reports Times of Israel.

She said: "No one knows what I went through, so how can you pass judgement and ask me questions?"

9 Protesters wore face covings as they called for justice Credit: Rex Features

9 Protesters gather in Tel Aviv after the alleged attack Credit: Rex Features

9 Signs of 'we believe you' are waved by demonstrators Credit: Rex Features

One of the girl's friends said one the suspects claimed he was a "medic and wanted to help" after coming across the victim.

But when it became clear she had been drinking, the suspect "took advantage of her and slept with her when she was out of control", reports Channel 13.

One of the arrested men claimed the security cameras would show it was consensual sex.

He claimed the men did line up outside the room, while the girl would call for them to come in.

Nine out of 10 rape cases in Israel are closed by prosecutors without charge, according to an annual survey released at the end 2019.

And shocking figures showed in 2018 some 63 per cent of alleged gang rape victims were aged between 12 and 18 in the country.

9 Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the alleged attack was a 'crime against humanity' Credit: Rex Features

Hotel owner Pnina Maman has claimed there is no evidence the assault took place in her establishment - saying CCTV doesn't show men in the hallways waiting to rape the victim.

Ms Maman said: "We are a hotel, not an educational institution. I’m not guilty of what happened.

"There were never 30 people in the hallways. We checked all the cameras. There was no gathering. This could have happened, unfortunately, in any hotel.

"We have no way of knowing what happens inside the rooms.”

Police officials said they had "indication that there were several people in the same room" and that this is a "complex investigation".

Most read in World News HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery DEADLIEST DAY India suffers record 3,689 Covid deaths as wards and crematoriums overwhelmed 'I'M DISGUSTED' Dad's fury as mum who killed their baby daughter allowed to work with KIDS GOING BALLISTIC Kim Jong-un reacts with fury to Biden's 'big blunder' after security blast MADDIE PROBE Maddie suspect lawyer claims he's 'only in frame as cops think they're smart' SWEAT & TEARS Indian mum, 35, with Covid suffocates in hospital car park waiting for bed

Defense Minister Benny Gantz added: “From yesterday afternoon, I’ve been trying, and failing, to understand: What is a man who is standing on a crowded line with dozens of others, on the way to a room where a young, disoriented girl is lying down, trying to prove?”

“The police investigation is still under way, but it’s important that I convey a message to those who participated or bore witness to this case or others: The only thing you’ve proven is what depravity of your soul and morality you are capable of.

“Before the criminal aspect, there is a moral soul-searching that must be done here.

"And to the complainant, it’s important that I say: My heart is with you, you are not alone.”
summary:
A TEENAGE girl has allegedly been gang raped by 30 men as the suspects filmed the attack in a resort on the Red Sea.
Detectives have launched an urgent investigation into the attack which allegedly occurred in a hotel room in Eilat, Israel.
The girl reported the attack on Friday, and two 27-year-old men from Hadera have been arrested.
One of the men reportedly told investigators that more than 30 men had sex with the girl, but he denied rape.
Men allegedly lined up outside the hotel room and patiently waited for their turn to rape the victim.

title: Woman, 37, appears in court charged with murder of newborn baby found dead in Hampshire woodland
text:
A WOMAN today appeared in court charged with the murder of a newborn baby boy discovered in woodland.

The "recently born baby", named Maliki Keresi, was found wrapped in a towel in Hythe, Hants, on March 5 last year.

2 Police in woodland last year after a newborn baby was found dead Credit: Solent

Silipa Keresi was arrested the same month but released on bail while enquiries continued.

But police confirmed today the 37-year-old has been charged with murder after being re-arrested at the weekend.

Keresi appeared at Southampton Magistrates' Court today for a brief hearing.

She spoke only to confirm her name, date of birth and address.

Keresi was remanded in custody to next appear at Winchester Crown Court on March 31.

Hants Police said: "Detectives arrested her again at the weekend and, following advice from the Crown Prosecution Service, have now charged her with the murder."

The tragic baby was discovered wrapped in a towel in woodland around 200 metres from a sailing club by a dog walker.

Most read in UK News 'MIRACLE' ESCAPE Man falls off 120ft cliff 'taking a selfie' & SURVIVES because tide was in HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home DEAL OR NO DEAL? Nazanin's husband has 'heard nothing' after Iran's claim she'll be freed KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash

An investigation was launched and police put out an appeal to find the boy's mum.

Dog walker Michael Dorsett, who found the tragic tot, said last year: "I saw something wrapped in a towel, lying by the bottom of a tree and I thought somebody had dumped a dead cat or a dead dog and then I saw a little arm or something sticking out.

"I peeled back the towel to have a look and I saw immediately it was a baby so I touched his face gently with the back of my finger and it was ice cold so I knew he had to be dead."
summary:
A WOMAN today appeared in court charged with the murder of a newborn baby boy discovered in woodland.
The "recently born baby", named Maliki Keresi, was found wrapped in a towel in Hythe, Hants, on March 5 last year.
2 Police in woodland last year after a newborn baby was found dead Credit: SolentSilipa Keresi was arrested the same month but released on bail while enquiries continued.
Keresi appeared at Southampton Magistrates' Court today for a brief hearing.
The tragic baby was discovered wrapped in a towel in woodland around 200 metres from a sailing club by a dog walker.

title: Who was Edward Heath and what did Carl Beech falsely accuse him of?
text:
SIR Edward Heath was Prime Minister from 1970 to 1974 - and was falsely accused of child sex abuse by Carl Beech.

He oversaw Britain's entry to the European Communities, the decimalisation of British coinage and the height of the Troubles in Northern Ireland — but what were the allegations of child abuse made against him?

4 Edward Heath was Prime Minister from 1970 to 1974 Credit: Getty - Contributor

Who was Edward Heath?

Edward Richard George Heath was born to a lower-middle class family in Broadstairs, Kent, on July 9, 1916.

He attended Chatham House Grammar School in Ramsgate before winning a county scholarship to study at Balliol College, Oxford.

Heath was a talented musician and became involved in Conservative politics at Oxford. He was elected president of the Oxford University Conservative Association.

When war broke out in 1939, Heath went to America to take part in a debating tour before being called up to serve.

4 He was accused of being involved in a child sex ring Credit: Hulton Archive - Getty

He received an emergency commission on March 22, 1941, as a second lieutenant in the Royal Artillery.

His work during the war earned him an MBE and he was demobbed in August 1946.

Heath began working in the Civil Service before resigning in November 1947 to stand as a Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for Bexley.

He was elected in the February 1950 election by a margin of 133 votes.

Heath was made Opposition Whip a year later, and worked up the Whips office to become Government Chief Whip under Anthony Eden in 1955.

He later served as Minister of Labour, Lord Privy Seal, Trade Secretary, President of the Board of Trade and Shadow Chancellor.

He became leader of the Conservative Party in 1965, and remained so despite losing the 1966 General Election.

Ted Heath eventually became Prime Minister in 1970, serving for four years. He was ousted as Tory leader by Margaret Thatcher in 1975.

Ted Heath died aged 89 on 17 July 2005.

4 Heath's friends blasted the investigation and claim it has left a 'cloud of suspicion' hanging over the former prime minister Credit: PA:Press Association

What were the paedophile allegations made against him?

A two-year £1.5million police investigation into Edward Heath was wrapped up in March 2017 after finding no evidence of child abuse.

Codenamed Operation Conifer, the investigation by Wiltshire Police was based largely on allegations that Sir Edward was involved in satanic orgies and a Westminster paedophile ring — dismissed as vicious fantasy by his supporters.

It began in August 2015 in the wake of the Jimmy Savile scandal when Supt Sean Memory stood outside Sir Ted's former house in Salisbury and appeal for victims to come forward.

Chief Constable Mike Veale reportedly said he was "120 per cent" convinced that sordid allegations against the former PM were true, an article in the Mail on Sunday said.

Carl Beech began an elaborate web of lies about being sexually abused as a child by some of Britain's most powerful people - which kickstarted Operation Midland - costing the police £2.5 million.

What did Carl Beech falsely accuse him of?

Wiltshire Police said Beech was one of 40 people who had made allegations against Sir Edward, who was living in Salisbury, Wiltshire, before his death in 2005.

Beech said that Heath was part of the gang of high-profile abusers including Jimmy Savile who abused him and other boys when they were younger.

Heath was implicated in the plot, claiming that he was part of the people who raped, kidnapped and murdered boys in the late 1970s and early 80s.

Beech also said he witnessed the alleged VIP sex ring kill three boys.

4 Beech accused the former Prime Minister of being in the Westminster paedo gang Credit: Times Newspapers Ltd

What did the child abuse inquiry report reveal?

Heath would be questioned over allegations that he raped and indecently assaulted boys as young as 10 were he alive today, the controversial police report said.

A Wiltshire Police investigation, called Operation Conifer, concluded that seven of the claims would have been sufficiently credible to justify questioning Sir Edward, who was prime minister under caution.

None of the allegations about which Wiltshire Police would have questioned Sir Edward relate to when he was prime minister, the force said.

The Crown Prosecution Service has a policy of not making a charging decision on a suspect who is dead because they cannot be prosecuted.

MOST READ IN NEWS HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

The allegations Sir Edward would have been questioned over include rape of a boy aged 11, indecent assault of a 10-year-old boy and the indecent assault of a 15-year-old boy during three "paid sexual encounters", and are said to have occurred between 1961 and 1992 in the Met Police, Kent, Sussex, the Channel Islands and Wiltshire force areas.

Carl Beech was found guilty of perverting the course of justice, one of fraud, and several child sexual offences.

Harvey Proctor, one of Beech's alleged abusers who gave evidence at trial, called for a fully independent investigation into Operation Midland, which he calls the "worst failing in the history of policing in the last 40 years".
summary:
SIR Edward Heath was Prime Minister from 1970 to 1974 - and was falsely accused of child sex abuse by Carl Beech.
4 Edward Heath was Prime Minister from 1970 to 1974 Credit: Getty - ContributorWho was Edward Heath?
Edward Richard George Heath was born to a lower-middle class family in Broadstairs, Kent, on July 9, 1916.
A two-year £1.5million police investigation into Edward Heath was wrapped up in March 2017 after finding no evidence of child abuse.
None of the allegations about which Wiltshire Police would have questioned Sir Edward relate to when he was prime minister, the force said.

title: Sex beast arrested for ‘raping 30 CHILDREN in a week’ in horrifying spate of attacks
text:
A MONSTER has been arrested for allegedly raping 30 children in one week in a horrifying spate of sex attacks.

The 28-year-old man from Manica Province in Mozambique targeted children aged between six and seven years old, cops said.

2 Cops said the man raped the kids while their parents were outside working Credit: Alamy

2 The sex attacks occurred in the 7 de Abril Quatres in Chimoio City Credit: Alamy

The Mozambique Republic Police said the man raped the kids while their parents were outside working - and he enticed the youngsters with money.

He carried out the sick sex attacks in the 7 de Abril Quatres in Chimoio City, according to Nation.

Figures from the cops show that two cases of rape are recorded every week in Manica Province.

More than 37 percent of women in Mozambique suffer physical and sexual violence in their lifetime, according to the country's latest Demographic and Health Survey.

Sexual offenders can be jailed for up to 12 years, which activists have said is too lenient, according to reports.

And Mozambique has previously come under fire for asking victims of sexual assault to make an official complaint before an investigation could be launched.

BRUTAL ATTACK

It comes after a young mum said she was repeatedly raped and brutally beaten for 11 days by 23 soldiers in Ethiopia.

The woman, 27, said she was brutalised by soldiers who forced nails and rocks into her vagina in the horror ordeal.

The woman said the troops tied her up and marched her through fields to a bush camp where she was raped and beaten for more than week, according to Reuters.

The mum is among hundreds of victims reporting horrific sexual violence by Ethiopian and allied Eritrean soldiers after fighting broke out in November in Tigray, doctors said.

Dr Fasika Amdeselassie, a top public health official for the government-appointed interim administration in Tigray, said some women are held captive for days or weeks at a time.

Nazanin's husband has 'heard nothing' after Iran's claim she'll be freed KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash

"Women are being kept in sexual slavery," Fasika said.

"The perpetrators have to be investigated."

If you are affected by any of the issues raised in this article, please call the Samaritans for free on 116123.
summary:
A MONSTER has been arrested for allegedly raping 30 children in one week in a horrifying spate of sex attacks.
The 28-year-old man from Manica Province in Mozambique targeted children aged between six and seven years old, cops said.
He carried out the sick sex attacks in the 7 de Abril Quatres in Chimoio City, according to Nation.
Figures from the cops show that two cases of rape are recorded every week in Manica Province.
The woman said the troops tied her up and marched her through fields to a bush camp where she was raped and beaten for more than week, according to Reuters.
